name: AchievementIcon
description:
Used to show an icon for any of the [Garry's Mod Steam achievements](http://steamcommunity.com/stats/GarrysMod/achievements).

If the viewer has not unlocked the achievement on Steam, the icon will be grayed out.

name: AvatarImage
description: Used to show a player's Steam avatar. You are recommended but not limited to pick one of the following sizes: 16, 32, 64, 84, 128, 184.

name: Awesomium
description:
<deprecated>You should be using <page>HTML</page> panel, which this is an alias of.</deprecated>

Base panel for elements using the [Awesomium](http://www.awesomium.com) UI engine.

<note>On the `x86-64` beta this panel isn't actually Awesomium, its the same as `HTML` (`HtmlPanel`)</note>

what you're doing because you can break a few things with it.

name: ContentIcon
description:
The spawn icon used for SWEPs and other SENTs, commonly featured as part of the spawn menu.
Do note that at least one of your ContentIcon's parents must either be an <page>EditablePanel</page> or derived from it
(like a <page>DFrame</page>, for example), else it won't be able to focus and thus be unclickable.

This control only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

name: ContentSidebar
description:
<internal></internal>

The ContentSidebar is internally used by the spawnmenu and manages things like the Spawnmenu Toolbar.
It internally uses a DTree which is accessible with ContentSidebar .Tree.
When <page>ContentSidebar:EnableModify</page> has been called ContentSidebar.Toolbox will return a <page>ContentSidebarToolbox</page>

functions.name: CreateSaveNotification
functions.description: Creates a Save Notification which will be shown when <page>SANDBOX:SpawnlistContentChanged</page> has been called.

arguments.name: hookname
arguments.description: A Populate Hook like PopulateEntities

functions.name: EnableModify
functions.description: Internally calls <page>ContentSidebar:EnableSearch</page>, <page>ContentSidebar:CreateSaveNotification</page> and creates a ContentSidebarToolbox which is accessible under ContentSidebar.Toolbox. Call the Hook <page>SANDBOX:OpenToolbox</page> to open the created Toolbox

functions.name: EnableSearch
functions.description: Creates a search bar which will be displayed over the Nodes.

arguments.name: hookname
arguments.description: A Populate Hook like PopulateEntities

name: ContentSidebarToolbox
description:
<internal></internal>
The ContentSidebarToolbox is internally used by the <page>ContentSidebar</page> and is used to change the icon of a category.
It internally consists of a <page>DTextEntry</page>, <page>DPanel</page>, <page>DImageButton</page>, <page>Panel</page>, <page>ContentHeader</page> and a <page>DIconBrowser</page>

name: ContextBase

name: ControlPanel
description: Used by the context menu in sandbox.

functions.name: AddControl
functions.description:
<deprecated>It is recommended to use <page>DForm</page>'s members instead.</deprecated>

Adds a control to the control panel.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
The control type to add. The complete list is:
* header
* textbox
* label
* checkbox/toggle
* slider
* propselect
* matselect
* ropematerial
* button
* numpad
* color
* combobox
* listbox
* materialgallery

arguments.name: controlinfo
arguments.description:
Each control takes their own table structure. You may search "AddControl" on GitHub for examples.

Here is a full list of each type and the table members it requires:

* header
* description

* textbox:
* label (def: "Untitled")
* command

* label:
* text

* checkbox, toggle (same thing):
* label (def: "Untitled")
* command
* help (boolean, if true assumes label is a language string (`#tool.toolname.stuff`) and adds `.help` at the end)

* slider: (<page>DForm:NumSlider</page>)
* type (optional string, if equals `float` then 2 digits after the decimal will be used, otherwise 0)
* label (def: `Untitled`)
* command
* min (def: `0`)
* max (def: `100`)
* help (boolean, see above)

* propselect:
* (data goes directly to PropSelect's :ControlValues(data))

* matselect:
* (data goes directly to MatSelect's :ControlValues(data))

* ropematerial:
* convar (notice: NOT called command this time!)

* button:
* label / text (if label is missing will use text. Def: `No Label`)
* command

* numpad:
* command
* command2
* label
* label2

* color:
* label
* red (convar)
* green (convar)
* blue (convar)
* alpha (convar)

* combobox:
* menubutton (if doesn't equal "1", becomes a listbox)
* folder
* options (optional, ha)
* cvars (optional)

* listbox:
* height (if set, becomes <page>DListView</page>, otherwise is <page>CtrlListBox</page>)
* label (def: `unknown`)
* options (optional)

* materialgallery:
* width (def: `32`)
* height (def: `32`)
* rows (def: `4`)
* convar
* options

returnValues.description: Returns created control

functions.description: Adds an item by calling <page>DForm:AddItem</page>.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: Panel to add as an item to the control panel.

name: CtrlListBox
description:
A <page>DComboBox</page> based dropdown menu with build in easy <page>ConVar</page> support.

This control only exists in Sandbox derived gamemodes.

name: DAdjustableModelPanel
description:
A derivative of the DModelPanel in which the user may modify the perspective of the model with their mouse and keyboard by clicking and dragging.

The keyboard keys <key>W</key> <key>S</key> <key>A</key> <key>D</key> <key>Up</key> <key>Down</key> <key>Left</key> <key>Right</key> <key>Space</key> and <key>Ctrl</key> can be used when the right mouse is held down, with <key>Shift</key> acting as a speed multiplier. When the left mouse is used, the Shift key holds the current `y` angle steady.

This is used by <page>IconEditor</page> for modifying spawn icons.

functions.name: CaptureMouse
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used by the panel to perform mouse capture operations when adjusting the model.

functions.name: FirstPersonControls
functions.description: <internal></internal> Used to adjust the perspective in the model panel via the keyboard, when the right mouse button is used.

functions.name: GetFirstPerson
functions.description:
Gets whether mouse and keyboard-based adjustment of the perspective has been enabled. See <page>DAdjustableModelPanel:SetFirstPerson</page> for more information.

This is an <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

returnValues.description: Whether first person controls are enabled. See <page>DAdjustableModelPanel:FirstPersonControls</page>.

functions.name: GetMovementScale
functions.description:
Returns the movement speed multiplier set by <page>DAdjustableModelPanel:SetMovementScale</page>.

An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

returnValues.description: The movement scale, where `1` is normal, `2` is double, etc.

functions.name: SetFirstPerson
functions.description:
Enables mouse and keyboard-based adjustment of the perspective.

This is set to `true` automatically each time mouse capture is enabled, and hence doesn't serve as a usable setting, other than to disable this functionality after the <page>PANEL:OnMousePressed</page> event.

An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether to enable/disable first person controls. See <page>DAdjustableModelPanel:FirstPersonControls</page>.

functions.name: SetMovementScale
functions.description: Sets the movement speed multiplier. Currently this only affects first person camera controls.

arguments.description: The movement scale, where `1` is normal, `2` is double, etc.

name: DAlphaBar
description: A bar to select the opacity (alpha level) of a color.

name: DCheckBox
description: The DCheckBox is a checkbox. It allows you to get a boolean value from the user (true/false - yes/no)

functions.name: DoClick
functions.description: Calls <page>DCheckBox:Toggle</page>

functions.name: GetChecked
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that gets the checked state of the checkbox.

returnValues.description: Whether the box is checked or not.

functions.name: IsEditing
functions.description: Returns whether the state of the checkbox is being edited. This means whether the user is currently clicking (mouse-down) on the checkbox, and applies to both the left and right mouse buttons.

returnValues.description: Whether the checkbox is being clicked.

functions.name: OnChange
functions.description: Called when the "checked" state is changed. This is for Overriding

arguments.name: bVal
arguments.description: Whether the CheckBox is checked or not.

functions.name: SetChecked
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the checked state of the checkbox. Does not call the checkbox's <page>DCheckBox:OnChange</page> and <page>Panel:ConVarChanged</page> methods, unlike <page>DCheckBox:SetValue</page>.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: Whether the box should be checked or not.

functions.name: SetValue
functions.description: Sets the checked state of the checkbox, and calls the checkbox's <page>DCheckBox:OnChange</page> and <page>Panel:ConVarChanged</page> methods.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: Whether the box should be checked or not.

functions.name: Toggle
functions.description: Toggles the checked state of the checkbox, and calls the checkbox's <page>DCheckBox:OnChange</page> and <page>Panel:ConVarChanged</page> methods. <page>DCheckBox:DoClick</page> is an alias of this function.

name: DCheckBoxLabel
description:
The **DCheckBoxLabel** is a <page>DCheckBox</page> with a <page>DLabel</page> next to it.
It allows you to get a boolean value from the user (true/false - yes/no)

functions.name: GetChecked
functions.description: Gets the checked state of the checkbox. This calls the checkbox's <page>DCheckBox:GetChecked</page> function.

returnValues.description: Whether the box is checked or not.

functions.name: GetIndent
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that gets the indentation of the element on the X axis. See also <page>DCheckBoxLabel:SetIndent</page>

returnValues.description: How much the content is moved to the right in pixels

functions.name: OnChange
functions.description: Called when the "checked" state is changed. This is meant to be Overriden

arguments.name: bVal
arguments.description: Whether the checkbox is checked or unchecked.

functions.name: SetBright
functions.description: Sets the color of the <page>DCheckBoxLabel</page>'s text to the bright text color defined in the skin.

arguments.name: bright
arguments.description: true makes the text bright.

functions.name: SetChecked
functions.description: Sets the checked state of the checkbox. Does not call <page>DCheckBoxLabel:OnChange</page> or <page>Panel:ConVarChanged</page>, unlike <page>DCheckBoxLabel:SetValue</page>.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: Whether the box should be checked or not.

functions.name: SetConVar
functions.description: Sets the console variable to be set when the checked state of the <page>DCheckBoxLabel</page> changes.

arguments.name: convar
arguments.description: The name of the convar to set

functions.name: SetDark

An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the <page>ConVar</page> name for the red channel of the color.

See also:
* <page>DColorPalette:SetConVarG</page> - For the green channel
* <page>DColorPalette:SetConVarB</page> - For the blue channel
* <page>DColorPalette:SetConVarA</page> - For the alpha channel

arguments.name: convar
arguments.description: The <page>ConVar</page> name for the red channel of the color

functions.name: SetNumRows
functions.description:
Roughly sets the number of colors that can be picked by the user. If the DColorPalette is exactly 6 rows tall, this function will set the number of colors shown per row in the palette. This is an <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>
<note><page>DColorPalette:Reset</page> or <page>DColorPalette:ResetSavedColors</page> must be called after this function to apply changes.</note>

arguments.name: rows
arguments.description: Scale for the range of colors that the user can pick. Default is 8.

functions.name: UpdateConVar
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Internal helper function for <page>DColorPalette:UpdateConVars</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the console variable to set

arguments.name: key
arguments.description:
The key of the 3rd argument to set the convar to
Possible values: "r", "g", "b", "a"

arguments.name: clr
arguments.description: The <page>Color</page> to retrieve the info from.

functions.name: UpdateConVars
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Updates all the console variables set by <page>DColorPalette:SetConVarR</page> and so on with given color.

Called internally when a palette color is clicked.

arguments.name: clr
arguments.description: A <page>Color</page>

name: DColumnSheet
description: Similar to <page>DPropertySheet</page>, but with tabs on the left.

functions.name: AddSheet
functions.description: Adds a new column/tab.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the column/tab

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: Panel to be used as contents of the tab. This normally would be a <page>DPanel</page>

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: Icon for the tab. This will ideally be a <page text="silkicon">Silkicons</page>, but any material name can be used.

returnValues.description:
A table containing the following keys:
* <page>Panel</page> Tab - The created tab button that will switch to the given panel
* <page>Panel</page> Panel - The given panel to switch to when the button is pressed

functions.name: GetActiveButton
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the active button of this <page>DColumnSheet</page>.

returnValues.description: The active button

functions.name: SetActiveButton
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that makes a button an active button for this <page>DColumnSheet</page>.

arguments.name: active
arguments.description: The button to make active button

functions.name: UseButtonOnlyStyle
functions.description: Makes the tabs/buttons show only the image and no text.

name: DComboBox
description: A field with multiple selectable values.

functions.name: AddChoice
functions.description: Adds a choice to the combo box.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The text show to the user.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description:
The data accompanying this string. If left empty, the value argument is used instead.

Can be accessed with the second argument of <page>DComboBox:GetSelected</page>, <page>DComboBox:GetOptionData</page> and as an argument of <page>DComboBox:OnSelect</page>.

arguments.name: select
arguments.description: Should this be the default selected text show to the user or not.

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: Adds an icon for this choice.

returnValues.description: The index of the new option.

functions.name: AddSpacer
functions.description: Adds a spacer below the currently last item in the drop down. Recommended to use with <page>DComboBox:SetSortItems</page> set to `false`.

functions.name: CheckConVarChanges
functions.description: <internal></internal>Ran every frame to update the value of this panel to the value of the associated convar. See <page>Panel:SetConvar</page>.

functions.name: ChooseOption
functions.description: Selects a combo box option by its index and changes the text displayed at the top of the combo box.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The text to display at the top of the combo box.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The option index.

functions.name: ChooseOptionID
functions.description: Selects an option within a combo box based on its table index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Selects the option with given index.

functions.name: Clear
functions.description: Clears the combo box's text value, choices, and data values.

functions.name: CloseMenu
functions.description: Closes the combo box menu. Called when the combo box is clicked while open.

functions.name: GetOptionData
functions.description: Returns an option's data based on the given index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The option index.

returnValues.description: The option's data value.

functions.name: GetOptionText
functions.description: Returns an option's text based on the given index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The option index.

returnValues.description: The option's text value.

functions.name: GetOptionTextByData
functions.description: Returns an option's text based on the given data.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description:
The data to look up the name of.

If given a <page>number</page> and no matching data was found, the function will test given data against each <page>Global.tonumber</page>'d data entry.

returnValues.description:
The option's text value.

If no matching data was found, the data itself will be returned. If multiple identical data entries exist, the first instance will be returned.

functions.name: GetSelected
functions.description: Returns the currently selected option's text and data

returnValues.description: The option's text value.
The option's stored data.

functions.name: GetSelectedID
functions.description: Returns the index (ID) of the currently selected option.

returnValues.description: The ID of the currently selected option.

functions.name: GetSortItems
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns an whether the items in the dropdown will be alphabetically sorted or not.

See <page>DComboBox:SetSortItems</page>.

returnValues.description: True if enabled, false otherwise.

functions.name: IsMenuOpen
functions.description: Returns whether or not the combo box's menu is opened.

returnValues.description: True if the menu is open, false otherwise.

functions.name: OnMenuOpened
functions.description: Called when the player opens the dropdown menu. For Override

arguments.name: menu
arguments.description: The <page>DMenu</page> menu panel.

functions.name: OnSelect
functions.description: Called when an option in the combo box is selected. This function does nothing by itself, you're supposed to overwrite it.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the option for use with other <page>DComboBox</page> functions.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The name of the option.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data assigned to the option.

functions.name: OpenMenu
functions.description: Opens the combo box drop down menu. Called when the combo box is clicked.

functions.name: RemoveChoice
functions.description: Removes a choice added with <page>DComboBox:AddChoice</page>

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index of the option to remove.

returnValues.name: text
returnValues.description: The text of the removed option.

returnValues.name: data
returnValues.description: The data of the removed option that was provided.

functions.name: SetSortItems
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets whether or not the items should be sorted alphabetically in the dropdown menu of the <page>DComboBox</page>. If set to false, items will appear in the order they were added by <page>DComboBox:AddChoice</page> calls.

This is enabled by default.

arguments.name: sort
arguments.description: true to enable, false to disable

functions.name: SetValue
functions.description: Sets the text shown in the combo box when the menu is not collapsed.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The text in the DComboBox.

name: DDragBase
description:
<internal></internal>

A VGUI base panel providing drag/drop functionality. Used by <page>DIconLayout</page>, <page>DListLayout</page> and <page>DTileLayout</page>.

functions.name: DropAction_Copy
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Internal function used in <page>DDragBase:MakeDroppable</page>

functions.name: DropAction_Normal
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Internal function used in <page>DDragBase:DropAction_Copy</page>

functions.name: DropAction_Simple
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Internal function used in <page>DDragBase:DropAction_Normal</page>

functions.name: GetDnD
functions.description: Returns the drag'n'drop group this panel belongs to. See <page>DDragBase:MakeDroppable</page>. An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

returnValues.description: Name of the DnD family.

functions.name: GetReadOnly
functions.description: Returns whether this panel is read only or not for drag'n'drop purposes. An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

returnValues.name: name
returnValues.description: Whether this panel is read only or not.

functions.name: GetUseLiveDrag
functions.description: Whether this panel uses live drag'n'drop previews. An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

functions.name: MakeDroppable
functions.description:
Makes the panel a receiver for any droppable panel with the same DnD name. Internally calls <page>Panel:Receiver</page>.

See <page>Drag and Drop for VGUI</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The unique name for the receiver slot. Only droppable panels with the same DnD name as this can be dropped on the panel.

arguments.name: allowCopy
arguments.description: Whether or not to allow droppable panels to be copied when the <key>Ctrl</key> key is held down.

functions.name: OnModified
functions.description: Called when anything is dropped on or rearranged within the <page>DDragBase</page>. For Override

functions.name: SetDnD
functions.description:
<internal></internal> Used internally by <page>DDragBase:MakeDroppable</page>.

See also <page>DDragBase:GetDnD</page>

An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the DnD family.

functions.name: SetDropPos
functions.description:
Determines where you can drop stuff.
"4" for left
"5" for center
"6" for right
"8" for top
"2" for bottom

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: Where you're allowed to drop things.

functions.name: SetReadOnly
functions.description: Sets whether this panel is read only or not for drag'n'drop purposes. If set to `true`, you can only copy from this panel, and cannot modify its contents. This is an <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Whether this panel should be read only or not.

functions.name: SetUseLiveDrag
functions.description: Whether to use live drag'n'drop previews. This is an <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page>

functions.name: UpdateDropTarget
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Internal function used in <page>DDragBase:DropAction_Normal</page>

name: DDrawer

functions.name: GetOpenTime

name: DEntityProperties
description:
<internal>
Unless you know what you are doing and you benefit from this panel, you should be using the <page>DProperties</page> instead.
</internal>

A panel used by the <page>Editable Entities</page> system.

functions.name: EditVariable
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called internally by <page>DEntityProperties:RebuildControls</page>.

functions.name: EntityLost
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called internally when an entity being edited became invalid.

You should use <page>DEntityProperties:OnEntityLost</page> instead.

functions.name: OnEntityLost
functions.description: Called when we were editing an entity and then it became invalid (probably removed). For Override

functions.name: RebuildControls
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called internally by <page>DEntityProperties:SetEntity</page> to rebuild the controls.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to edit

name: DExpandButton
description:
<internal></internal>
The little "+" button used by <page>DProperties</page> and <page>DTree_Node</page>.

functions.name: GetExpanded
functions.description: Returns whether this DExpandButton is expanded or not.

returnValues.description: True if expanded, false otherwise

functions.name: SetExpanded
functions.description: Sets whether this DExpandButton should be expanded or not. Only changes appearance.

arguments.name: expanded
arguments.description: True to expand ( visually will show a "-" )

name: DFileBrowser
description:
A tree and list-based file browser.

It allows filtering by folder (directory) name and file extension, and can display models as <page>SpawnIcon</page>s.

functions.name: Clear
functions.description: Clears the file tree and list, and resets all values.

functions.name: GetBaseFolder
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the root directory/folder of the file tree.

returnValues.description: The path to the root folder.

functions.name: GetCurrentFolder
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the current directory/folder being displayed.

returnValues.description: The directory the file list is currently displaying.

functions.name: GetFileTypes
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the current file type filter on the file list.

returnValues.description: The current filter applied to the file list.

functions.name: GetFolderNode
functions.description:
Returns the <page>DTree Node</page> that the file tree stems from.

This is a child of the root node of the <page>DTree</page>.

returnValues.description: The <page>DTree_Node</page> used for the tree.

functions.name: GetModels
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns whether or not the model viewer mode is enabled. In this mode, files are displayed as <page>SpawnIcon</page>s instead of a list.

returnValues.description: Whether or not files will be displayed using <page>SpawnIcon</page>s.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the name being used for the file tree.

returnValues.description: The name used for the root of the file tree.

functions.name: GetOpen
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns whether or not the file tree is open.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the file tree is open.

functions.name: GetPath
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the access path of the file tree. This is `GAME` unless changed with <page>DFileBrowser:SetPath</page>.

See <page>file.Read</page> for how paths work.

returnValues.description: The current access path i.e. "GAME", "LUA", "DATA" etc.

functions.name: GetSearch
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that returns the current search filter on the file tree.

returnValues.description: The filter in use on the file tree.

functions.name: OnDoubleClick
functions.description:
Called when a file is double-clicked.

<note>Double-clicking a file or icon will trigger **both** this and <page>DFileBrowser:OnSelect</page>.</note>

arguments.name: selectedPanel
arguments.description:
The panel that was double-clicked to select this file.

This will either be a DListView_Line or SpawnIcon depending on whether the model viewer mode is enabled. See DFileBrowser:SetModels.

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.description: The path to the file that was double-clicked.

functions.name: OnRightClick
functions.description:
Called when a file is right-clicked.

<note>When not in model viewer mode, <page>DFileBrowser:OnSelect</page> will also be called if the file is not already selected.</note>

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.description: The path to the file that was right-clicked.

arguments.name: selectedPanel
arguments.description:
The panel that was right-clicked to select this file. This will either be a DListView_Line or SpawnIcon depending on whether the model viewer mode is enabled.
See DFileBrowser:SetModels.

functions.name: OnSelect
functions.description: Called when a file is selected.

arguments.name: selectedPanel
arguments.description:
The panel that was clicked to select this file.

This will either be a DListView_Line or SpawnIcon depending on whether the model viewer mode is enabled. See DFileBrowser:SetModels.

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.description: The path to the file that was selected.

functions.name: SetBaseFolder
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the root directory/folder of the file tree.

This needs to be set for the file tree to be displayed.

arguments.name: baseDir
arguments.description: The path to the folder to use as the root.

functions.name: SetCurrentFolder
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the directory/folder from which to display the file list.

arguments.name: currentDir
arguments.description: The directory to display files from.

functions.name: SetFileTypes
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the file type filter for the file list.

This accepts the same file extension wildcards as <page>file.Find</page>.

arguments.name: fileTypes
arguments.description:
A list of file types to display, separated by spaces e.g.
```
"*.lua *.txt *.mdl"
```

functions.name: SetModels
functions.description:
Enables or disables the model viewer mode. In this mode, files are displayed as <page>SpawnIcon</page>s instead of a list.

<note>This should only be used for `.mdl` files; the spawn icons will display error models for others. See <page>DFileBrowser:SetFileTypes</page></note>

arguments.name: showModels
arguments.description: Whether or not to display files using <page>SpawnIcon</page>s.

functions.name: SetName
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the name to use for the file tree.

arguments.name: treeName
arguments.description: The name for the root of the file tree. Passing no value causes this to be the base folder name. See <page>DFileBrowser:SetBaseFolder</page>.

functions.name: SetOpen
functions.description: An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that opens or closes the file tree.

arguments.name: open
arguments.description: `true` to open the tree, `false` to close it.

arguments.name: useAnim
arguments.description: If `true`, the <page>DTree</page>'s open/close animation is used.

functions.name: SetPath
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the access path for the file tree. This is set to `GAME` by default.

See <page>file.Read</page> for how paths work.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The access path i.e. "GAME", "LUA", "DATA" etc.

functions.name: SetSearch
functions.description:
An <page>Global.AccessorFunc</page> that sets the search filter for the file tree.

This accepts the same wildcards as <page>file.Find</page>.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.description: The filter to use on the file tree.

functions.name: Setup
functions.description:
<internal></internal> Called to set up the <page>DTree</page> and file viewer when a base path has been set.

Calls <page>DFileBrowser:SetupTree</page> and <page>DFileBrowser:SetupFiles</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the variables needed to set up have been defined.

functions.name: SetupFiles
functions.description:
<internal></internal> Called to set up the <page>DListView</page> or <page>DIconBrowser</page> by <page>DFileBrowser:Setup</page>.

The icon browser is used when in models mode. See <page>DFileBrowser:SetModels</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the files pane was set up successfully.

functions.name: SetupTree
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to set up the <page>DTree</page> by <page>DFileBrowser:Setup</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the tree was set up successfully.

functions.name: ShowFolder
functions.description:
<internal></internal>Builds the file or icon list for the current directory.

You should use <page>DFileBrowser:SetCurrentFolder</page> to change the directory.

arguments.name: currentDir
arguments.description: The directory to populate the list from.

functions.name: SortFiles
functions.description:
Sorts the file list.

<note>This is only functional when not using the model viewer. See <page>DFileBrowser:SetModels</page></note>

arguments.name: descending
arguments.description: The sort order. `true` for descending (z-a), `false` for ascending (a-z).

name: DForm

If this method is called with only one argument, it is added to the bottom of the form. If two arguments are passed, they are placed side-by-side at the bottom of the form.

Internally, this function is used by the various DForm functions to, for example, add labels to the left of buttons.

functions.name: PropSelect
functions.description: Creates a <page>PropSelect</page> panel and docks it to the top of the DForm.

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: The label to display above the prop select.

arguments.name: convar
arguments.description: The convar to set the selected model to.

arguments.name: models
arguments.description:
A table of models to display for selection. Supports 2 formats:
1) Key is the model and value are the <page>convar</page>s to set when that model is selected in format `convar=value`
2) An table of tables where each table must have the following keys:
* <page>string</page> model - The model.
* <page>number</page> skin - Model's skin. Defaults to 0
* <page>string</page> tooltip - Displayed when user hovers over the model. Defaults to the model path.
* The key of the table is the value of the convar.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the prop select panel, in 64px icon increments.

returnValues.description: The created <page>PropSelect</page> panel.

name: DFrame
description: The DFrame is the moma of basically all VGUI elements. 98% of the time you will parent your element to this.

functions.name: Center
functions.description: Centers the frame relative to the whole screen and invalidates its layout. This overrides <page>Panel:Center</page>.

functions.name: Close
functions.description:
Hides or removes the DFrame, and calls <page>DFrame:OnClose</page>.

To set whether the frame is hidden or removed, use <page>DFrame:SetDeleteOnClose</page>.

functions.name: GetBackgroundBlur
functions.description: Gets whether the background behind the frame is being blurred.

returnValues.description: Whether or not background blur is enabled.

functions.name: GetDeleteOnClose
functions.description: Determines whether or not the DFrame will be removed when it is closed. This is set with <page>DFrame:SetDeleteOnClose</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the frame will be removed on close.

functions.name: GetDraggable
functions.description: Gets whether or not the frame is draggable by the user.

returnValues.description: Whether the frame is draggable or not.

functions.name: GetIsMenu
functions.description: Gets whether or not the frame is part of a derma menu. This is set with <page>DFrame:SetIsMenu</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not this frame is a menu component.

functions.name: GetMinHeight
functions.description:
Gets the minimum height the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

You must call <page>DFrame:SetSizable</page> before the user can resize the frame.

returnValues.description: The minimum height the user can resize the frame to.

functions.name: GetMinWidth
functions.description:
Gets the minimum width the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

You must call <page>DFrame:SetSizable</page> before the user can resize the frame.

returnValues.description: The minimum width the user can resize the frame to.

functions.name: GetPaintShadow
functions.description: Gets whether or not the shadow effect bordering the DFrame is being drawn.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the shadow is being drawn.

functions.name: GetScreenLock
functions.description: Gets whether or not the DFrame is restricted to the boundaries of the screen resolution.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the frame is restricted.

functions.name: GetSizable
functions.description:
Gets whether or not the DFrame can be resized by the user.

This is achieved by clicking and dragging in the bottom right corner of the frame.

returnValues.description: Whether the frame can be resized or not.

functions.name: GetTitle
functions.description: Returns the title of the frame.

returnValues.description: Title of the frame.

functions.name: IsActive
functions.description: Determines if the frame or one of its children has the screen focus.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the frame has focus.

functions.name: OnClose
functions.description:
Called when the DFrame is closed with <page>DFrame:Close</page>. This applies when the `close` button in the DFrame's control box is clicked.

This function does nothing and is safe to override.

This is **not** called when the DFrame is removed with <page>Panel:Remove</page>, see <page>PANEL:OnRemove</page> for that.

functions.name: SetBackgroundBlur
functions.description: Indicate that the background elements won't be usable.

arguments.name: blur
arguments.description: Whether or not to block mouse on background panels or not.

functions.name: SetDeleteOnClose
functions.description: Determines whether or not the DFrame is removed when it is closed with <page>DFrame:Close</page>.

arguments.name: shouldDelete
arguments.description: Whether or not to delete the frame on close. This is `true` by default.

functions.name: SetDraggable
functions.description: Sets whether the frame should be draggable by the user. The DFrame can only be dragged from its title bar.

arguments.name: draggable
arguments.description: Whether to be draggable or not.

functions.name: SetIcon
functions.description: Adds or removes an icon on the left of the <page>DFrame</page>'s title.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
Set to nil to remove the icon.

Otherwise, set to file path to create the icon.

functions.name: SetIsMenu
functions.description:
Sets whether the frame is part of a derma menu or not.

If this is set to `true`, <page>Global.CloseDermaMenus</page> will not be called when the frame is clicked, and thus any open menus will remain open.

arguments.name: isMenu
arguments.description: Whether or not this frame is a menu component.

functions.name: SetMinHeight
functions.description:
Sets the minimum height the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

This only applies to users attempting to resize the frame; <page>Panel:SetTall</page> and similar methods will not be affected. You must call <page>DFrame:SetSizable</page> before the user can resize the frame.

arguments.name: minH
arguments.description: The minimum height the user can resize the frame to.

functions.name: SetMinWidth
functions.description:
Sets the minimum width the DFrame can be resized to by the user.

This only applies to users attempting to resize the frame; <page>Panel:SetWide</page> and similar methods will not be affected. You must call <page>DFrame:SetSizable</page> before the user can resize the frame.

arguments.name: minW
arguments.description: The minimum width the user can resize the frame to.

functions.name: SetPaintShadow
functions.description: Sets whether or not the shadow effect bordering the DFrame should be drawn.

arguments.name: shouldPaint
arguments.description: Whether or not to draw the shadow. This is `true` by default.

functions.name: SetScreenLock
functions.description: Sets whether the DFrame is restricted to the boundaries of the screen resolution.

arguments.name: lock
arguments.description: If `true`, the frame cannot be dragged outside of the screen bounds

functions.name: SetSizable
functions.description:
Sets whether or not the <page>DFrame</page> can be resized by the user.

This is achieved by clicking and dragging in the bottom right corner of the frame.

You can set the minimum size using <page>DFrame:SetMinWidth</page> and <page>DFrame:SetMinHeight</page>.

arguments.name: sizeable
arguments.description: Whether the frame should be resizeable or not.

functions.name: SetTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the frame.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: New title of the frame.

functions.name: ShowCloseButton
functions.description: Determines whether the DFrame's control box (close, minimise and maximise buttons) is displayed.

arguments.name: show
arguments.description: `false` hides the control box; this is `true` by default.

name: DGrid
description:
A really simple grid layout panel.

<note>This panel will set its size automatically based on set column count.
This makes it play badly with <page>Panel:Dock</page> and cause a <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> call every frame.</note>

functions.name: AddItem
functions.description: Adds a new item to the grid.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: The item to add. It will be forced visible and parented to the <page>DGrid</page>.

functions.name: GetCols
functions.description: Returns the number of columns of this <page>DGrid</page>. Set by <page>DGrid:SetCols</page>.

returnValues.description: The number of columns of this <page>DGrid</page>

functions.name: GetColWide
functions.description: Returns the width of each column of the <page>DGrid</page>, which is set by <page>DGrid:SetColWide</page>.

returnValues.description: The width of each column

functions.name: GetItems
functions.description: Returns a list of panels in the grid.

returnValues.description: A list of <page>Panel</page>s.

functions.name: GetRowHeight
functions.description: Returns the height of each row of the <page>DGrid</page>, which is set by <page>DGrid:SetRowHeight</page>.

returnValues.description: The height of each row

functions.name: RemoveItem
functions.description: Removes given panel from the <page>DGrid:GetItems</page>.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: Item to remove from the grid

arguments.name: bDontDelete
arguments.description: If set to true, the actual panel will not be removed via <page>Panel:Remove</page>.

functions.name: SetCols
functions.description:
Sets the number of columns this panel should have.

The <page>DGrid</page> will resize its width to match this value.

arguments.name: cols
arguments.description: The desired number of columns

functions.name: SetColWide
functions.description:
Sets the width of each column.

The cell panels (grid items) will not be resized or centered.

arguments.name: colWidth
arguments.description: The width of each column.

functions.name: SetRowHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of each row.

The cell panels (grid items) will not be resized or centered.

arguments.name: rowHeight
arguments.description: The height of each row

functions.name: SortByMember
functions.description: Sorts the items in the grid. Does not visually update the grid, use <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page> for that.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: A key in the panel from <page>DGrid:GetItems</page>. The key's value must be numeric.

arguments.name: desc
arguments.description: True for descending order, false for ascending.

functions.description:

Sets the local X coordinate of where the player started dragging the thing

arguments.name: pnl

functions.name: SetLeftMin
functions.description: Sets the minimum width of the left side

name: DHorizontalScroller
description:
A very basic horizontal scrollable panel, similar to <page>DScrollPanel</page>.

Used internally in <page>DPropertySheet</page>.

functions.name: AddPanel
functions.description: Adds a panel to the <page>DHorizontalScroller</page>.

arguments.description: The panel to add. It will be automatically parented.

functions.name: GetCanvas
functions.description: Returns the internal canvas panel where the content of <page>DHorizontalScroller</page> are placed on.

returnValues.description: The <page>DDragBase</page> panel.

functions.name: GetOverlap
functions.description: Returns the overlap set by <page>DHorizontalScroller:SetOverlap</page>.

returnValues.description: The overlap.

functions.name: GetShowDropTargets
functions.description: Returns whether this panel should show drop targets.

functions.name: MakeDroppable
functions.description:
Same as <page>DDragBase:MakeDroppable</page>.
TODO: Transclude or whatever to here?

functions.name: OnDragModified
functions.description: Called when the panel is scrolled.

functions.name: ScrollToChild
functions.description: Scrolls the <page>DHorizontalScroller</page> to given child panel.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The target child panel. Must be a child of <page>DHorizontalScroller:GetCanvas</page>

functions.name: SetOverlap
functions.description: Controls the spacing between elements of the horizontal scroller.

arguments.name: overlap
arguments.description: Overlap in pixels. Positive numbers will make elements `overlap` each other, negative will add spacing.

functions.name: SetScroll
functions.description: Sets the scroll amount, automatically clamping the value.

name: DHScrollBar
description:
A generic horizontal scrollbar. See the vertical alternative [here](DVScrollBar).

The scrollbar notably contains `DHScrollBar.btnLeft`, `DHScrollBar.btnRight`, and `DHScrollBar.btnGrip` which are the left button, right button, and grip respectively. Editing the paint functions of these allows custom scrollbar styling, although it is a better idea to use [Derma Skins](Derma_Skin_Creation).

functions.name: AddScroll
functions.description: Adds specified amount of scroll in pixels.

arguments.name: add
arguments.description: How much to scroll rightwards. Can be negative for leftwards scroll

returnValues.description: True if the scroll level was changed (i.e. if we did or did not scroll)

functions.name: AnimateTo
functions.description: Smoothly scrolls to given level.

arguments.name: scroll
arguments.description: The scroll level to animate to. In pixels from the left ( from 0 )

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: Length of the animation in seconds

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay of the animation in seconds

arguments.name: ease
arguments.description: See <page>Panel:NewAnimation</page> for explanation.

functions.name: BarScale
functions.description: Returns the scale of the scroll bar based on the difference in size between the visible "window" into the canvas that is being scrolled. Should be used after <page>DHScrollBar:SetUp</page>.

returnValues.description: The scale of the scrollbar.

functions.name: GetHideButtons
functions.description: Returns whether or not the manual left/right scroll buttons are visible or not. Set by <page>DHScrollBar:SetHideButtons</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the manual left/right scroll buttons are visible or not.

functions.name: GetOffset
functions.description: Returns the negative of <page>DHScrollBar:GetScroll</page>.

returnValues.description: The scroll offset.

functions.name: GetScroll
functions.description: Returns the amount of scroll level from the left in pixels.

returnValues.description: The amount of scroll level from the left edge.

functions.name: Grip
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called from within <page>DScrollBarGrip</page>

functions.name: SetHideButtons
functions.description: Allows hiding the left and right buttons for better visual stylisation.

arguments.name: hide
arguments.description: True to hide

functions.name: SetScroll
functions.description: Sets the scroll level in pixels.

arguments.name: scroll
arguments.description: The new scroll value.

functions.name: SetUp
functions.description:
Sets up the scrollbar for use.

The scrollbar will automatically disable itself if the total width of the canvas is lower than the width of the panel that holds the canvas during this function call.

arguments.name: barSize
arguments.description: The size of the panel that holds the canvas, basically size of "1 page".

arguments.name: canvasSize
arguments.description: The total size of the canvas, this typically is the bigger number.

name: DHTML
description:
The DHTML control wraps the internal Awesomium framework, supports calling Javascript functions from Lua,
as well as running Lua from within the HTML. Running Lua code is disabled by default.

functions.name: AddFunction
functions.description:
Defines a Javascript function that when called will call a Lua callback.
<note>Must be called after the HTML document has fully loaded.</note>

arguments.name: library
arguments.description: Library name of the JS function you are defining.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the JS function you are defining.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: Function called when the JS function is called. Arguments passed to the JS function will be passed here.

functions.name: Call
functions.description:
Runs/Executes a string as JavaScript code in a panel. This function does **NOT** evaluate expression (i.e. allow you to pass variables from JavaScript (JS) to Lua context).
Because a return value is nil/no value (a.k.a. void).
If you wish to pass/return values from JS to Lua, you may want to use DHTML:AddFunction function to accomplish that job. This function is an alias of DHTML:QueueJavascript ([source](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/lua/vgui/dhtml.lua#L62)).

arguments.name: js
arguments.description: Specify JavaScript code to be executed.

functions.name: ConsoleMessage
functions.description:
Called when the page inside the <page>DHTML</page> window runs the `console.log` javascript function. On the x86-64 beta, it's called for all built-in `console.*` javascript functions.

If <page>DHTML:SetAllowLua</page> is set to `true` and the message begins with `RUNLUA:`, the text following `RUNLUA:` will be executed as code within the Lua environment (this is how Lua is called from DHTML windows).

arguments.name: msg
arguments.description: The message to be logged (or Lua code to be executed; see above).

functions.name: GetAllowLua
functions.description: Returns if the loaded page can run Lua code, set by <page>DHTML:SetAllowLua</page>

returnValues.description: Whether or not Lua code can be called from the loaded page.

functions.name: GetScrollbars
functions.description:
<deprecated>Broken. Use the CSS `overflow` rule instead.</deprecated>

Returns the value set by <page>DHTML:SetScrollbars</page>.

returnValues.name: show
returnValues.description: True if scrollbars should be visible.

functions.name: OnBeginLoadingDocument
functions.description: Called when this panel begins loading a page.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the current page.

functions.name: OnCallback
functions.description: Called by the engine when a callback function is called.

arguments.name: library
arguments.description: Library name of the JS function that was called.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the JS function that was called.

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.description: Table containing all arguments passed to the JS function.

returnValues.description: Return `true` to suppress default engine action.

functions.name: OnChangeTargetURL
functions.description: Called by HTML panels when the target URL of the frame has changed, this happens when you hover over a link.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: New target URL.

functions.name: OnChangeTitle
functions.description: Called by HTML panels when the title of the loaded page has been changed.

arguments.name: newTitle
arguments.description: The new title of the page.

functions.name: OnChildViewCreated
functions.description: Called by HTML panels when the page attempts to open a new child view (such as a popup or new tab).

arguments.name: sourceURL
arguments.description: The URL of the page requesting to create a child.

arguments.name: targetURL
arguments.description: The URL of the requested child.

arguments.name: isPopup
arguments.description: True if the requested view is a popup.

functions.name: OnDocumentReady
functions.description: Called by HTML panels when the panel's DOM has been set up. You can run JavaScript in here.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the current page.

functions.name: OnFinishLoadingDocument
functions.description: Called when this panel successfully loads a page.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the current page.

functions.name: QueueJavascript
functions.description:
Runs/Executes a string as JavaScript code in a panel. This function does **NOT** evaluate expression (i.e. allow you to pass variables from JavaScript (JS) to Lua context).
Because a return value is nil/no value (a.k.a. void).
If you wish to pass/return values from JS to Lua, you may want to use DHTML:AddFunction function to accomplish that job. If Panel:IsVisible is `false`, PANEL:Think will **NOT** run, meaning the Javascript Queue will not be processed.

Consider overriding PANEL:Paint to stop the panel from drawing instead.

arguments.name: js
arguments.description: Specify JavaScript code to be executed.

functions.name: SetAllowLua
functions.description: Determines whether the loaded page can run Lua code or not. See <page>DHTML</page> for how to run Lua from a DHTML window.

arguments.name: allow
arguments.description: Whether or not to allow Lua.

functions.name: SetScrollbars
functions.description: <deprecated>Broken. Use the CSS `overflow` rule instead.</deprecated> Sets if the loaded window should display scrollbars when the webpage is larger than the viewing window. This is similar to the CSS `overflow` rule.

arguments.name: show
arguments.description: True if scrollbars should be visible.
