name: DIconLayout
description:
DIconLayout is what replaced <page>DPanelList</page> in Garry's Mod 13.
DPanelList still exists in GMod but is deprecated and does not support the new GWEN skin.

<page>DIconLayout</page> is used to make a list of panels.
Unlike DPanelList, DIconLayout does not automatically add a scroll bar - the example below shows you how you can do this.

functions.name: Copy
functions.description: Creates a replica of the DIconLayout it is called on.

returnValues.description: The replica.

functions.name: CopyContents
functions.description: Copies the contents (Child elements) of another <page>DIconLayout</page> to itself.

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: <page>DIconLayout</page> to copy from.

functions.name: GetBorder
functions.description: Returns the size of the border.

functions.name: GetLayoutDir
functions.description: Returns the direction that it will be layed out, using the DOCK enumerations.

returnValues.description: Layout direction.

functions.name: GetSpaceX
functions.description: Returns the distance between two 'icons' on the X axis.

returnValues.description: Distance between two 'icons' on the X axis.

functions.name: GetSpaceY
functions.description: Returns distance between two "Icons" on the Y axis.

returnValues.description: distance between two "Icons" on the Y axis.

functions.name: GetStretchHeight
functions.description:
Returns whether the icon layout will stretch its height to fit all the children.

See also <page>DIconLayout:GetStretchWidth</page>

functions.name: GetStretchWidth
functions.description:
Returns whether the icon layout will stretch its width to fit all the children.

See also <page>DIconLayout:GetStretchHeight</page>

functions.name: Layout
functions.description: Resets layout vars before calling <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>. This is called when children are added or removed, and must be called when the spacing, border or layout direction is changed.

functions.name: LayoutIcons_LEFT
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally to layout the child elements if the <page>DIconLayout:SetLayoutDir</page> is set to LEFT (See <page>Enums/DOCK</page>).

functions.name: LayoutIcons_TOP
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally to layout the child elements if the <page>DIconLayout:SetLayoutDir</page> is set to TOP (See <page>Enums/DOCK</page>).

functions.name: OnModified
functions.description: Called when the panel is modified.

functions.name: SetBorder
functions.description: Sets the internal border (padding) within the DIconLayout. This will not change its size, only the positioning of children. You must call <page>DIconLayout:Layout</page> in order for the changes to take effect.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The border (padding) inside the DIconLayout.

functions.name: SetLayoutDir
functions.description:
Sets the direction that it will be layed out, using the <page>Enums/DOCK</page>.

Currently only TOP and LEFT are supported.

arguments.name: direction
arguments.description: <page>Enums/DOCK</page>

functions.name: SetSpaceX
functions.description: Sets the horizontal (x) spacing between children within the DIconLayout. You must call <page>DIconLayout:Layout</page> in order for the changes to take effect.

arguments.name: xSpacing
arguments.description: The width of the gap between child objects.

functions.name: SetSpaceY
functions.description: Sets the vertical (y) spacing between children within the DIconLayout. You must call <page>DIconLayout:Layout</page> in order for the changes to take effect.

arguments.name: ySpacing
arguments.description: The vertical gap between rows in the DIconLayout.

functions.name: SetStretchHeight
functions.description:
If set to true, the icon layout will stretch its height to fit all the children.

See also <page>DIconLayout:SetStretchWidth</page>

functions.name: SetStretchWidth
functions.description:
If set to true, the icon layout will stretch its width to fit all the children.

See also <page>DIconLayout:SetStretchHeight</page>

name: DImage
description:
<page>DImage</page> is an advanced, more robust version of the <page>Material</page> panel.

See <page>DImageButton</page> for a click-able version of this panel.

functions.name: DoLoadMaterial
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Actually loads the <page>IMaterial</page> to render it. Called from <page>DImage:LoadMaterial</page>.

functions.name: FixVertexLitMaterial
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

"Fixes" the current material of the <page>DImage</page> if it has VertexLit shader by creating a new one with the same name and a prefix of "_DImage" and automatically calling <page>DImage:SetMaterial</page> with the new material.

This fixes the problem where using materials using shaders that expect lighting information causing "weird" flickering when displayed in 2D/Unlit environment.

functions.name: GetFailsafeMatName
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Returns the texture path set by <page>DImage:SetFailsafeMatName</page>.

functions.name: GetImage
functions.description: Returns the image loaded in the image panel.

returnValues.description: The path to the image that is loaded.

functions.name: GetImageColor
functions.description: Returns the color override of the image panel.

returnValues.name: col
returnValues.description: The color override of the image. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetKeepAspect
functions.description:
Returns whether the <page>DImage</page> should keep the aspect ratio of its image when being resized.

See <page>DImage:SetKeepAspect</page> for more info on how it works.

returnValues.description: Whether the <page>DImage</page> should keep the aspect ratio of its image when being resized.

functions.name: GetMaterial
functions.description: Returns the current <page>Global.Material</page> of the <page>DImage</page>.

functions.name: GetMatName
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Returns the texture path set by <page>DImage:SetMatName</page>.

functions.name: LoadMaterial
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Initializes the loading process of the material to render if it is not loaded yet.

You do not need to call this function. It is done for you automatically.

functions.name: PaintAt
functions.description: Paints a ghost copy of the DImage panel at the given position and dimensions. This function overrides <page>Panel:PaintAt</page>.

arguments.name: posX
arguments.description: The x coordinate to draw the panel from.

arguments.name: posY
arguments.description: The y coordinate to draw the panel from.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the panel image to be drawn.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the panel image to be drawn.

functions.name: SetFailsafeMatName
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Sets the backup material to be loaded when the image is first rendered. Used by <page>DImage:SetOnViewMaterial</page>.

functions.name: SetImage
functions.description:
Sets the image to load into the frame. If the first image can't be loaded and `strBackup` is set, that image will be loaded instead.

This eventually calls <page>DImage:SetMaterial</page>.

arguments.name: strImage
arguments.description: The path of the image to load. When no file extension is supplied the VMT file extension is used.

arguments.name: strBackup
arguments.description: The path of the backup image.

functions.name: SetImageColor
functions.description: Sets the image's color override.

arguments.name: col
arguments.description: The color override of the image. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetKeepAspect
functions.description:
Sets whether the <page>DImage</page> should keep the aspect ratio of its image when being resized.

Note that this will not try to fit the image inside the button, but instead it will fill the button with the image.

arguments.name: keep
arguments.description: true to keep the aspect ratio, false not to

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description: Sets a <page>Global.Material</page> directly as an image.

arguments.name: mat
arguments.description: The material to set

functions.name: SetMatName
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Sets the material to be loaded when the image is first rendered. Used by <page>DImage:SetOnViewMaterial</page>.

functions.name: SetOnViewMaterial
functions.description:
Similar to <page>DImage:SetImage</page>, but will only do the expensive part of actually loading the textures/material if the material is about to be rendered/viewed.

Useful for cases like <page>DIconBrowser</page>, where there are hundreds of small icons in 1 panel in a list that do not need all to be loaded at the same time.

functions.name: Unloaded
functions.description: Returns true if the image is **not** yet loaded.

name: DImageButton
description:
An image button.

This panel inherits all methods of <page>DButton</page>, such as <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>.

functions.name: DepressImage
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally to briefly scale the image when clicked.

functions.name: GetDepressImage
functions.description: Returns whether <page>DImageButton:DepressImage</page> is functional or not.

returnValues.name: enable
returnValues.description: `true` to enable image depressing when clicked.

functions.name: GetImage
functions.description: Returns the "image" of the <page>DImageButton</page>. Equivalent of <page>DImage:GetImage</page>.

returnValues.description: The path to the image that is loaded.

functions.name: GetStretchToFit
functions.description:
Returns whether the image inside the button should be stretched to fit it or not

See <page>DImageButton:SetStretchToFit</page>

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description: Sets the color of the image. Equivalent of <page>DImage:SetImageColor</page>

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The <page>Global.Color</page> to set

functions.name: SetDepressImage
functions.description: Controls whether <page>DImageButton:DepressImage</page> is functional or not.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: `true` to enable image depressing when clicked.

functions.name: SetIcon
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Alias of <page>DImageButton:SetImage</page>.

functions.name: SetImage
functions.description: Sets the "image" of the <page>DImageButton</page>. Equivalent of <page>DImage:SetImage</page>.

arguments.name: strImage
arguments.description: The path of the image to load. When no file extension is supplied the VMT file extension is used.

arguments.name: strBackup
arguments.description: The path of the backup image.

functions.name: SetImageVisible
functions.description: Hides or shows the image of the image button. Internally this calls <page>Panel:SetVisible</page> on the internal <page>DImage</page>.

arguments.name: visible
arguments.description: Set true to make it visible ( default ), or false to hide the image

functions.name: SetKeepAspect
functions.description:
Sets whether the <page>DImageButton</page> should keep the aspect ratio of its image. Equivalent of <page>DImage:SetKeepAspect</page>.

Note that this will not try to fit the image inside the button, but instead it will fill the button with the image.

arguments.name: keep
arguments.description: true to keep the aspect ratio, false not to

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description: Sets a <page>Global.Material</page> directly as an image. Equivalent of <page>DImage:SetMaterial</page>.

arguments.name: mat
arguments.description: The material to set

functions.name: SetOnViewMaterial
functions.description: See <page>DImage:SetOnViewMaterial</page>

functions.name: SetStretchToFit
functions.description:
Sets whether the image inside the <page>DImageButton</page> should be stretched to fill the entire size of the button, without preserving aspect ratio.

If set to false, the image will not be resized at all.

arguments.name: stretch
arguments.description: True to stretch, false to not to stretch

name: DKillIcon
description: Uses the <page>killicon</page> to persistently draw a killicon.

functions.name: GetName
functions.description: Gets the killicon being shown.

returnValues.description: The name of the killicon currently being displayed.

functions.name: SetName
functions.description:
Sets the killicon to be displayed. You should call <page>Panel:SizeToContents</page> following this.

Killicons can be added with <page>killicon.Add</page> and <page>killicon.AddFont</page>.

arguments.name: iconName
arguments.description: The name of the killicon to be displayed.

name: DLabel
description:
A standard Derma text label. A lot of this panels functionality is a base for button elements, such as <page>DButton</page>

Does not support multiline text.

functions.name: DoClick
functions.description:
Called when the label is left clicked (on key release) by the player.

This will be called after <page>DLabel:OnDepressed</page> and <page>DLabel:OnReleased</page>.

This can be overridden; by default, it calls <page>DLabel:Toggle</page>.

See also <page>DLabel:DoRightClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoMiddleClick</page> and <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

functions.name: DoClickInternal
functions.description:
Called just before <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>.

In <page>DLabel</page> does nothing and is safe to override. Used by <page>DMenuOption</page> and <page>DCollapsibleCategory</page>'s tabs.

functions.name: DoDoubleClick
functions.description:
Called when the label is double clicked by the player with left clicks.

<page>DLabel:SetDoubleClickingEnabled</page> must be set to true for this hook to work, which it is by default.

This will be called after <page>DLabel:OnDepressed</page> and <page>DLabel:OnReleased</page> and <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>.

See also <page>DLabel:DoRightClick</page> and <page>DLabel:DoMiddleClick</page>.

functions.name: DoDoubleClickInternal
functions.description: Called just before <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>. In <page>DLabel</page> does nothing and is safe to override.

functions.name: DoMiddleClick
functions.description:
Called when the label is middle mouse (Mouse wheel, also known as mouse 3) clicked (on key release) by the player.

This will be called after <page>DLabel:OnDepressed</page> and <page>DLabel:OnReleased</page>.

See also <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoRightClick</page> and <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

functions.name: DoRightClick
functions.description:
Called when the label is right clicked (on key release) by the player.

This will be called after <page>DLabel:OnDepressed</page> and <page>DLabel:OnReleased</page>.

See also <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoMiddleClick</page> and <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

functions.name: GetAutoStretchVertical
functions.description:
Returns whether the label stretches vertically or not.

Set by <page>DLabel:SetAutoStretchVertical</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether the label stretches vertically or not.

functions.name: GetBright
functions.description:
Returns whether the <page>DLabel</page> should set its text color to the current skin's bright text color.

See <page>DLabel:SetBright</page>.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description:
Returns the actual color of the text.

See also <page>DLabel:GetTextColor</page> and <page>DLabel:GetTextStyleColor</page>.

returnValues.description: The the actual color of the text.

functions.name: GetDark
functions.description:
Returns whether the <page>DLabel</page> should set its text color to the current skin's dark text color.

See <page>DLabel:SetDark</page>.

functions.name: GetDisabled
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>Panel:IsEnabled</page> instead.</deprecated>

Gets the disabled state of the <page>DLabel</page>. This is set with <page>DLabel:SetDisabled</page>.

returnValues.description: The disabled state of the label.

functions.name: GetDoubleClickingEnabled
functions.description:
Returns whether or not double clicking will call <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

See <page>DLabel:SetDoubleClickingEnabled</page>.

returnValues.description: true = enabled, false means disabled

functions.name: GetDrawBackground
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>DLabel:GetPaintBackground</page> instead.</deprecated>

Returns whether or not the panel background is being drawn. Alias of <page>DLabel:GetPaintBackground</page>.

returnValues.description: True if the panel background is drawn, false otherwise.

functions.name: GetFont
functions.description: Returns the current font of the DLabel. This is set with <page>DLabel:SetFont</page>.

returnValues.description: The name of the font in use.

functions.name: GetHighlight
functions.description:
Returns whether the <page>DLabel</page> should set its text color to the current skin's highlighted text color.

See <page>DLabel:SetHighlight</page>.

functions.name: GetIsMenu
functions.description:
Used internally by <page>DComboBox</page>.

Returns whether the frame is part of a derma menu or not.

If this is `true`, <page>Global.CloseDermaMenus</page> will not be called when the frame is clicked, and thus any open menus will remain open.

returnValues.name: isMenu
returnValues.description: Whether this panel is a Menu Component

functions.name: GetIsToggle
functions.description: Returns whether the toggle functionality is enabled for a label. Set with <page>DLabel:SetIsToggle</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether or not toggle functionality is enabled.

functions.name: GetPaintBackground
functions.description: Returns whether or not the background should be painted.

returnValues.description: If the background is painted or not

functions.name: GetTextColor
functions.description: Returns the "override" text color, set by <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page>.

returnValues.description: The color of the text, or nil.

functions.name: GetTextStyleColor
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Returns the "internal" or fallback color of the text.

See also <page>DLabel:GetTextColor</page> and <page>DLabel:SetTextStyleColor</page>.

returnValues.description: The "internal" color of the text

functions.name: GetToggle
functions.description:
Returns the current toggle state of the label. This can be set with <page>DLabel:SetToggle</page> and toggled with <page>DLabel:Toggle</page>.

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call <page>DLabel:SetIsToggle</page> with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

returnValues.description: The current toggle state.

functions.name: OnDepressed
functions.description:
Called when the player presses the label with any mouse button.

This works as an alternative to <page>PANEL:OnMousePressed</page> as that hook is used heavily by <page>DLabel</page> and overriding it will break functionality.

See also <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoMiddleClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoRightClick</page>, <page>DLabel:OnReleased</page> and <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

functions.name: OnReleased
functions.description:
Called when the player releases any mouse button on the label. This is always called after <page>DLabel:OnDepressed</page>.

This works as an alternative to <page>PANEL:OnMouseReleased</page> as that hook is used heavily by <page>DLabel</page> and overriding it will break functionality.

See also <page>DLabel:DoClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoMiddleClick</page>, <page>DLabel:DoRightClick</page> and <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

functions.name: OnToggled
functions.description:
Called when the toggle state of the label is changed by <page>DLabel:Toggle</page>.

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call <page>DLabel:SetIsToggle</page> with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

arguments.name: toggleState
arguments.description: The new toggle state.

functions.name: SetAutoStretchVertical
functions.description: Automatically adjusts the height of the label dependent of the height of the text inside of it.

arguments.name: stretch
arguments.description: Whenever to stretch the label vertically or not.

functions.name: SetBright
functions.description:
Sets the color of the text to the bright text color defined in the skin.

Disables <page>DLabel:SetDark</page>. Gets overridden by <page>DLabel:SetHighlight</page>.

You should only consider using this if you are using background elements that are not manually painted and are using the skin colors. Otherwise use <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page>.

arguments.name: bright
arguments.description: Whenever to set the text to bright or not.

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description: Changes color of label. Alias of <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page>.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to set. Uses the Color structure.

functions.name: SetDark
functions.description:
Sets the color of the text to the dark text color defined in the skin.

Disables <page>DLabel:SetBright</page>. Gets overridden by <page>DLabel:SetHighlight</page>.

You should only consider using this if you are using background elements that are not manually painted and are using the skin colors. Otherwise use <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page>.

arguments.name: dark
arguments.description: Whenever to set the text to dark or not.

functions.name: SetDisabled
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>Panel:SetEnabled</page> instead.</deprecated>

Sets the disabled state of the <page>DLabel</page>.

When disabled, the label does not respond to click, toggle or drag & drop actions.

arguments.name: disable
arguments.description: `true` to disable the DLabel, `false` to enable it.

functions.name: SetDoubleClickingEnabled
functions.description:
Sets whether or not double clicking should call <page>DLabel:DoDoubleClick</page>.

This is enabled by default.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: true to enable, false to disable

functions.name: SetDrawBackground
functions.description: <deprecated>You should use <page>DLabel:SetPaintBackground</page> instead.</deprecated>Sets whether or not to draw the panel background. Alias of <page>DLabel:SetPaintBackground</page>.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: True to show the panel's background, false to hide it.

functions.name: SetFont
functions.description: Sets the font of the label.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description:
The name of the font.

See <page text="here">Default_Fonts</page> for a list of existing fonts.
Alternatively, use <page>surface.CreateFont</page> to create your own custom font.

functions.name: SetHighlight
functions.description:
Sets the color of the text to the highlight text color defined in the skin.

For the default Derma skin this makes the label red.

Overrides colors set by both <page>DLabel:SetBright</page> and <page>DLabel:SetDark</page> while active.

You should only consider using this if you are using background elements that are not manually painted and are using the skin colors. Otherwise use <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page>.

arguments.name: highlight
arguments.description: true to set the label's color to skins's text highlight color, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetIsMenu
functions.description:
Used internally by <page>DComboBox</page>.


Sets whether the frame is part of a derma menu or not.

If this is set to `true`, <page>Global.CloseDermaMenus</page> will not be called when the frame is clicked, and thus any open menus will remain open.

arguments.name: isMenu
arguments.description: Whether this pane is a Menu Component

functions.name: SetIsToggle
functions.description:
Enables or disables toggle functionality for a label. Retrieved with <page>DLabel:GetIsToggle</page>.

You must call this before using <page>DLabel:SetToggle</page>, <page>DLabel:GetToggle</page> or <page>DLabel:Toggle</page>.

arguments.name: allowToggle
arguments.description: Whether or not to enable toggle functionality.

functions.name: SetPaintBackground
functions.description: Sets whether or not the background should be painted. This is mainly used by derivative classes, such as <page>DButton</page>.

functions.name: SetTextColor
functions.description: Sets the text color of the <page>DLabel</page>. This will take precedence over <page>DLabel:SetTextStyleColor</page>.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The text color. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetTextStyleColor
functions.description:
<internal>Use <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page> instead!</internal>


Used by <page>DLabel:SetDark</page>, <page>DLabel:SetBright</page> and <page>DLabel:SetHighlight</page> to set the text color without affecting <page>DLabel:SetTextColor</page> calls.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The text color. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: SetToggle
functions.description:
Sets the toggle state of the label. This can be retrieved with <page>DLabel:GetToggle</page> and toggled with <page>DLabel:Toggle</page>.

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call <page>DLabel:SetIsToggle</page> with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

arguments.name: toggleState
arguments.description: The toggle state to be set.

functions.name: Toggle
functions.description:
Toggles the label's state. This can be set and retrieved with <page>DLabel:SetToggle</page> and <page>DLabel:GetToggle</page>.

In order to use toggle functionality, you must first call <page>DLabel:SetIsToggle</page> with `true`, as it is disabled by default.

functions.name: UpdateColours
functions.description: A hook called from within <page>PANEL:ApplySchemeSettings</page> to determine the color of the text on display.

arguments.name: skin
arguments.description: A table supposed to contain the color values listed above.

functions.name: UpdateFGColor
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called internally to update the color of the text.

name: DLabelEditable
description:
An editable <page>DLabel</page>, double click on it to edit.

This is used in the spawnmenu spawnlist headers.

functions.name: GetAutoStretch
functions.description: Returns whether the editable label will stretch to the text entered or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the editable label will stretch to the text entered or not.

functions.name: IsEditing
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>DLabelEditable</page> is being edited or not. (i.e. has focus)

returnValues.description: Whether this <page>DLabelEditable</page> is being edited or not

functions.name: OnLabelTextChanged
functions.description:
A hook called when the player presses Enter (i.e. the finished editing the label) and the text has changed.

Allows you to override/modify the text that will be set to display.

arguments.name: txt
arguments.description: The original user input text

returnValues.description: If provided, will override the text that will be applied to the label itself.

functions.name: SetAutoStretch
functions.description: Sets whether the editable label should stretch to the text entered or not.

arguments.name: stretch
arguments.description: Whether the editable label should stretch to the text entered or not.

name: DLabelURL
description:
Underlined link label without a DoClick function. When a valid URL is set and the label is clicked, it will open a browser window and navigate to the address.

This panel uses <page>gui.OpenURL</page> internally and its restrictions apply.

functions.name: GetAutoStretchVertical
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Does absolutely nothing at all.

returnValues.name: draw
returnValues.description: Does nothing.

functions.name: GetColor
functions.description: Gets the current text color of the <page>DLabelURL</page>. Returns either <page>DLabelURL:GetTextColor</page> or if that is unset -  <page>DLabelURL:GetTextStyleColor</page>.

returnValues.description: The current text <page>Global.Color</page>.

functions.name: GetTextColor
functions.description: Gets the current text color of the <page>DLabelURL</page> set by <page>DLabelURL:SetTextColor</page>.

returnValues.description: The current text <page>Global.Color</page>.

functions.name: GetTextStyleColor
functions.description: Returns the color set by <page>DLabelURL:SetTextStyleColor</page>.

returnValues.description: The <page>Color</page>

functions.name: SetAutoStretchVertical
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Does absolutely nothing at all.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: Does nothing.

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description: Alias of <page>DLabelURL:SetTextColor</page>.

arguments.name: col
arguments.description: The <page>Global.Color</page> to use.

functions.name: SetTextColor
functions.description:
Sets the text color of the <page>DLabelURL</page>. Overrides <page>DLabelURL:SetTextStyleColor</page>.


This should only be used immediately after it is created, and otherwise <page>Panel:SetFGColor</page>.

arguments.name: col
arguments.description: The <page>Global.Color</page> to use.

functions.name: SetTextStyleColor
functions.description: Sets the base text color of the <page>DLabelURL</page>. This is overridden by <page>DLabelURL:SetTextColor</page>.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The <page>Global.Color</page> to set

functions.name: UpdateFGColor
functions.description: <internal></internal>Used internally to set correct text color via <page>Panel:SetFGColor</page> and <page>DLabelURL:GetColor</page>.

name: DListBox
description:
<deprecated>
Derived from the deprecated <page>DPanelList</page>.
</deprecated>

A simple list box with optional multi-select.
As this is deprecated, it is recommended that you use <page>DListView</page>, which contains the same functionality with multi-column options.

functions.name: GetMultiple
functions.description: Returns whether the list box can select multiple items.

returnValues.name: multiple
returnValues.description: Whether the list box can select multiple items.

functions.name: GetSelectedItems
functions.description: Returns selected items.

returnValues.description: The selected items. A list of <page>DListBoxItem</page>.

functions.name: GetSelectedValues
functions.description: Returns selected item values.

returnValues.description: The selected item values. A list of <page>Panel:GetValue</page> of each selected <page>DListBoxItem</page>.

functions.name: SelectByName
functions.description: Select a <page>DListBoxItem</page> based on its value.

arguments.name: val
arguments.description: <page>Panel:GetValue</page> of a <page>DListBoxItem</page> to select.

functions.name: SelectItem
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally to select a specific panel.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: <page>DListBox</page> to select.

arguments.name: onlyme
arguments.description: Whether to deselect other selected items.

functions.name: SetMultiple
functions.description: Sets whether the list box can select multiple items.

arguments.name: multiple
arguments.description: Whether the list box can select multiple items.

functions.name: SetSelectedItems
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Sets selected items.

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: The items to select. A list of <page>DListBoxItem</page>.

name: DListBoxItem
description:
<deprecated>
Used Internally by <page>DListBox</page>.
</deprecated>

functions.name: GetMother
functions.description: Returns the parent "mother" of this **DListBoxItem** set by <page>DListBoxItem:SetMother</page>.

returnValues.description: The "mother" <page>DListBox</page>.

functions.name: Select
functions.description: Selects this item.

arguments.name: onlyMe
arguments.description: Whether to deselect other items.

functions.name: SetMother
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Sets the "mother" (parent) panel for this item. Done internally by <page>DListBox:AddItem</page>

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The "mother" panel to set.

name: DListLayout
description:
A vertical list of panels that optionally allows child elements to be rearranged with the mouse cursor.

Child panels' widths are set to the width of the DListLayout, and it resizes vertically to accommodate the heights of all children. You can place this inside a <page>DScrollPanel</page> when adding many panels.

To enable the drag & drop rearrangement functionality, call <page>DDragBase:MakeDroppable</page> on the DListLayout with a unique identifier. All panels added following this will be moveable.

name: DListView
description: A data view with rows and columns.

functions.name: AddColumn
functions.description: Adds a column to the listview.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The name of the column to add.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description:
At which position to insert the new column compared to the other columns. Set to 1 to add the new column before all other columns.

By default the column will be placed after all columns.

returnValues.description: The newly created <page>DListView_Column</page>.

functions.name: AddLine
functions.description: Adds a line to the list view.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Values for a new row in the DListView, If several arguments are supplied, each argument will correspond to a respective column in the DListView.

returnValues.description: The newly created <page>DListView_Line</page>.

functions.name: ClearSelection
functions.description: Clears the current selection in the DListView.

functions.name: ColumnWidth
functions.description: Gets the width of a column.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The column to get the width of.

returnValues.description: Width of the column.

functions.name: DataLayout
functions.description: Creates the lines and gets the height of the contents, in a DListView.

returnValues.description: The height of the contents

functions.name: DisableScrollbar
functions.description: Removes the scrollbar.

functions.name: DoDoubleClick
functions.description: Called when a line in the DListView is double clicked.

arguments.name: lineID
arguments.description: The line number of the double clicked line.

arguments.name: line
arguments.description: The double clicked <page>DListView_Line</page>.

functions.name: FixColumnsLayout
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Internal helper function called from the <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> of <page>DListView</page>.

functions.name: GetCanvas
functions.description: Gets the canvas.

returnValues.description: The canvas.

functions.name: GetDataHeight
functions.description:
Returns the height of the data of the <page>DListView</page>.

See also <page>DListView:SetDataHeight</page>.

returnValues.description: The height of the data of the <page>DListView</page>.

functions.name: GetDirty
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

See <page>DListView:SetDirty</page>.

functions.name: GetHeaderHeight
functions.description:
Returns the height of the header of the <page>DListView</page>.

See also <page>DListView:SetHeaderHeight</page>.

returnValues.description: The height of the header of the <page>DListView</page>.

functions.name: GetHideHeaders
functions.description: Returns whether the header line should be visible on not.

returnValues.description: Whether the header line should be visible on not.

functions.name: GetInnerTall
functions.description:
Returns the height of <page>DListView:GetCanvas</page>.

Intended to represent the height of all data lines.

returnValues.description: The height of <page>DListView:GetCanvas</page>.

functions.name: GetLine
functions.description: Gets the <page>DListView_Line</page> at the given index.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The index of the line to get.

returnValues.description: The <page>DListView_Line</page> at the given index.

functions.name: GetLines
functions.description: Gets all of the lines added to the DListView.

returnValues.description: The lines added to the DListView.

functions.name: GetMultiSelect
functions.description:
Returns whether multiple lines can be selected or not.

See <page>DListView:SetMultiSelect</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether multiple lines can be selected or not.

functions.name: GetSelected
functions.description: Gets all of the lines that are currently selected.

returnValues.description: A table of <page>DListView_Line</page>s.

functions.name: GetSelectedLine
functions.description:
Gets the currently selected <page>DListView_Line</page> index.

If <page>DListView:SetMultiSelect</page> is set to true, only the first line of all selected lines will be returned. Use <page>DListView:GetSelected</page> instead to get all of the selected lines.

returnValues.description: The index of the currently selected line.
The currently selected <page>DListView_Line</page>.

functions.name: GetSortable
functions.description:
Returns whether sorting of columns by clicking their headers is allowed or not.

See also <page>DListView:SetSortable</page>.

returnValues.description: Whether sorting of columns by clicking their headers is allowed or not

functions.name: GetSortedID
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Converts LineID to SortedID

arguments.name: lineId
arguments.description: The <page>DListView_Line:GetID</page> of a line to look up

functions.name: OnClickLine
functions.description:
<internal>Use <page>DListView:OnRowSelected</page> instead!</internal>

Called whenever a line is clicked.

arguments.name: line
arguments.description: The selected line.

arguments.name: isSelected
arguments.description: Boolean indicating whether the line is selected.

functions.name: OnRequestResize
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called from <page>DListView_Column</page>.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The column which initialized the resize

functions.name: OnRowRightClick
functions.description: Called when a row is right-clicked

arguments.name: lineID
arguments.description: The line ID of the right clicked line

arguments.name: line
arguments.description: The line panel itself, a <page>DListView_Line</page>.

functions.name: OnRowSelected
functions.description: Called internally by <page>DListView:OnClickLine</page> when a line is selected. This is the function you should override to define the behavior when a line is selected.

arguments.name: rowIndex
arguments.description: The index of the row/line that the user clicked on.

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: The <page>DListView_Line</page> that the user clicked on.

functions.name: RemoveLine
functions.description: Removes a line from the list view.

arguments.name: line
arguments.description: Removes the given row, by row id (same number as <page>DListView:GetLine</page>).

functions.name: SelectFirstItem
functions.description: Selects the line at the first index of the DListView if one has been added.

functions.name: SelectItem
functions.description: Selects a line in the listview.

arguments.name: Line
arguments.description: The line to select.

functions.name: SetDataHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of all lines of the <page>DListView</page> except for the header line.

See also <page>DListView:SetHeaderHeight</page>.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The new height to set. Default value is 17.

functions.name: SetDirty
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally to signify if the <page>DListView</page> needs a rebuild.

functions.name: SetHeaderHeight
functions.description:
Sets the height of the header line of the <page>DListView</page>.

See also <page>DListView:SetDataHeight</page>.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The new height to set. Default value is 16.

functions.name: SetHideHeaders
functions.description: Sets whether the header line should be visible on not.

arguments.name: hide
arguments.description: Whether the header line should be visible on not.

functions.name: SetMultiSelect
functions.description: Sets whether multiple lines can be selected by the user by using the <key>Ctrl</key> or <key>Shift</key> keys. When set to false, only one line can be selected.

arguments.name: allowMultiSelect
arguments.description: Whether multiple lines can be selected or not

functions.name: SetSortable
functions.description:
Enables/disables the sorting of columns by clicking.
<note>
This will only affect columns that are created after this function is called. Existing columns will be unaffected.
</note>

arguments.name: isSortable
arguments.description: Whether sorting columns with clicking is allowed or not.

functions.name: SortByColumn
functions.description: Sorts the items in the specified column.

arguments.name: columnIndex
arguments.description: The index of the column that should be sorted.

arguments.name: descending
arguments.description: Whether the items should be sorted in descending order or not.

functions.name: SortByColumns
functions.description:
Sorts the list based on given columns.

All arguments are optional

name: DListView_Column
description:
<internal></internal>

A single column, used by <page>DListView</page>.

functions.name: DoClick
functions.description:
Called when the column is left clicked (on key release) by the client.

See also <page>DListView_Column:DoRightClick</page>.

functions.name: DoRightClick
functions.description:
Called when the column is right clicked (on key release) by the client.

See also <page>DListView_Column:DoClick</page>.

functions.name: GetColumnID
functions.description: Gets the index used for this column.

returnValues.name: index
returnValues.description: The column index of the <page>DListView_Column</page>.

functions.name: GetDescending
functions.description: Returns whether the column is sorted in descending order or not.

returnValues.name: desc
returnValues.description: Whether the column is sorted in descending order or not.

functions.name: GetFixedWidth
functions.description: Returns the fixed width of this column.

returnValues.name: width
returnValues.description: The fixed width.

functions.name: GetMaxWidth
functions.description: Returns the maximum width set with <page>DListView_Column:SetMaxWidth</page>.

returnValues.name: width
returnValues.description: The maximum width

functions.name: GetMinWidth
functions.description: Returns the minimum width set with <page>DListView_Column:SetMinWidth</page>.

returnValues.name: width
returnValues.description: The minimum width

functions.name: GetTextAlign
functions.description: Returns the text alignment for the column

returnValues.name: alignment
returnValues.description: The direction of the content, based on the number pad. See <page>DListView_Column:SetTextAlign</page>.

functions.name: ResizeColumn
functions.description: Resizes the column, additionally adjusting the size of the column to the right, if any.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
The amount to add to the current column's width.

Positive values will make it wider, and negative values will make it thinner.

functions.name: SetColumnID
functions.description: <internal></internal>Sets the index used for this column.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The column index of the <page>DListView_Column</page>.

functions.name: SetDescending
functions.description: Sets whether the column is sorted in descending order or not.

arguments.name: desc
arguments.description: Whether the column is sorted in descending order or not.

functions.name: SetFixedWidth
functions.description:
Sets the fixed width of the column.
<note>
Internally this will set <page text="SetMinWidth">DListView_Column:SetMinWidth</page> and <page text="SetMaxWidth">DListView_Column:SetMaxWidth</page> to the value provided
</note>

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The number value which will determine a fixed width.

functions.name: SetMaxWidth
functions.description: Sets the maximum width of a column.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The number value which will determine a maximum width.

functions.name: SetMinWidth
functions.description: Sets the minimum width of a column.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The number value which will determine a minimum width.

functions.name: SetName
functions.description: Sets the text in the column's header.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The new name that the column's header will use.

functions.name: SetTextAlign
functions.description: Sets the text alignment for the column

arguments.name: alignment
arguments.description:
The direction of the content, based on the number pad.

|   |   |   |
| --- | --- | --- |
| <key>7</key>: **top-left** | <key>8</key>: **top-center**	| <key>9</key>: **top-right** |
| <key>4</key>: **middle-left** | <key>5</key>: **center** | <key>6</key>: **middle-right** |
| <key>1</key>: **bottom-left** | <key>2</key>: **bottom-center** | <key>3</key>: **bottom-right** |

functions.name: SetWidth
functions.description: Sets the width of the panel.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The number value which will determine panel width.

name: DListView_ColumnPlain
description:
<internal>
Used by <page>DListView</page>.
</internal>

name: DListView_DraggerBar
description: <internal>Used by <page>DListView</page>.</internal>

name: DListView_Line
description:
<internal></internal>

A panel used by <page>DListView</page>

functions.name: DataLayout
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called by <page>DListView:DataLayout</page>

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: The list view.

functions.name: GetAltLine
functions.description: Returns whether this line is odd or even in the list. This is internally used (and set) to change the looks of every other line.

returnValues.name: alt
returnValues.description: Whether this line is 'alternative'.

functions.name: GetColumnText
functions.description:
Gets the string held in the specified column of a <page>DListView_Line</page> panel.

This is the same thing as doing <page text="DListView_Line:GetValue">Panel:GetValue</page>( column_number ).

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The number of the column to retrieve the text from, starts with 1.

returnValues.description: The contents of the specified column.

functions.name: GetID
functions.description: Returns the ID of this line, set automatically in <page>DListView:AddLine</page>.

returnValues.description: The ID of this line.

functions.name: GetListView
functions.description: Returns the parent <page>DListView</page> of this line.

returnValues.name: pnl
returnValues.description: The parent <page>DListView</page> of this line.

functions.name: GetSortValue
functions.description:
Returns the data stored on given cell of this line.

Used in the <page>DListView:SortByColumn</page> function in case you want to sort with something else than the text.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The number of the column to write the text from, starts with 1.

returnValues.name: data
returnValues.description: The data that is set for given column of this line, if any.

functions.name: GetValue
functions.description: Alias of <page>DListView_Line:GetColumnText</page>. Overrides <page>Panel:GetValue</page>.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The number of the column to retrieve the text from, starts with 1.

returnValues.description: The contents of the specified column.

functions.name: IsLineSelected
functions.description: Returns whether this line is selected.

returnValues.name: selected
returnValues.description: Whether this line is selected.

functions.name: OnRightClick
functions.description: Called when the player right clicks this line.

functions.name: OnSelect
functions.description: Called when the player selects this line.

functions.name: SetAltLine
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Sets whether this line is odd or even in the list. This is internally used (and set automatically) to change the looks of every other line.

arguments.name: alt
arguments.description: Whether this line is 'alternative'.

functions.name: SetColumnText
functions.description: Sets the string held in the specified column of a <page>DListView_Line</page> panel.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The number of the column to write the text from, starts with 1.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Column text you want to set

returnValues.name: label
returnValues.description: The DLabel in which the text was set.

functions.name: SetID
functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Sets the ID of this line, used internally by <page>DListView:AddLine</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID for this line.

functions.name: SetListView
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Sets the parent <page>DListView</page> for this line. Used internally by <page>DListView:AddLine</page>.

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: The new parent <page>DListView</page> for this line.

functions.name: SetSelected
functions.description: Sets whether this line is selected or not.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description: Whether this line is selected.

functions.name: SetSortValue
functions.description:
Allows you to store data per column.

Used in the <page>DListView:SortByColumn</page> function in case you want to sort with something else than the text.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The number of the column to write the text from, starts with 1.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: Data for given column on the line you wish to set.

functions.name: SetValue
functions.description: Alias of <page>DListView_Line:SetColumnText</page>.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: The number of the column to write the text from, starts with 1.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Column text you want to set

returnValues.name: label
returnValues.description: The DLabel in which the text was set.

name: DMenu
description: A simple menu with sub menu, icon and convar support.

functions.name: AddCVar
functions.description: Creates a <page>DMenuOptionCVar</page> and adds it as an option into the menu. Checking and unchecking the option will alter the given console variable's value.

arguments.name: strText
arguments.description: The text of the button

arguments.name: convar
arguments.description: The console variable to change

arguments.name: on
arguments.description: The value of the console variable to set when the option is checked

arguments.name: off
arguments.description: The value of the console variable to set when the option is unchecked

arguments.name: funcFunction
arguments.description:
If set, the function will be called every time the option is pressed/clicked/selected.

<callback>
<arg type="Panel" name="pnl">The <page>DMenuOptionCVar</page> that was clicked.</arg>
</callback>

returnValues.description: The created <page>DMenuOptionCVar</page>

functions.name: AddOption
functions.description: Add an option to the DMenu

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the option.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
Function to execute when this option is clicked.

<callback>
<arg type="Panel" name="pnl">The <page>DMenuOption</page> that was clicked.</arg>
</callback>

returnValues.description: Returns the created <page>DMenuOption</page> panel.

functions.name: AddPanel
functions.description:
Adds a panel to the <page>DMenu</page> as if it were an option.

This invokes <page>DScrollPanel:AddItem</page> and will not create a new panel if a class name is passed, unlike <page>Panel:Add</page>.

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: The panel that you want to add.

functions.name: AddSpacer
functions.description: Adds a horizontal line spacer.

functions.name: AddSubMenu
functions.description: Add a sub menu to the DMenu

arguments.name: Name
arguments.description: Name of the sub menu.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
Function to execute when this sub menu is clicked.

<callback>
<arg type="Panel" name="pnl">The <page>DMenuOption</page> that was clicked.</arg>
</callback>

returnValues.description: The created sub <page>DMenu</page>
The created <page>DMenuOption</page>

functions.name: ChildCount
functions.description: Returns the number of child elements of <page>DMenu</page>'s <page>DScrollPanel:GetCanvas</page>.

returnValues.description: The number of child elements

functions.name: ClearHighlights
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Clears all highlights made by <page>DMenu:HighlightItem</page>.

Doesn't appear to be used or do anything.

functions.name: CloseSubMenu
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally by <page>DMenu:OpenSubMenu</page>.

arguments.name: menu
arguments.description: The menu to close

functions.name: GetChild
functions.description: Gets a child by its index.

arguments.name: childIndex
arguments.description:
The index of the child to get.

<note>Unlike <page>Panel:GetChild</page>, this index starts at 1.</note>

functions.name: GetDeleteSelf
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Set by <page>DMenu:SetDeleteSelf</page>

functions.name: GetDrawBorder
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Returns the value set by <page>DMenu:SetDrawBorder</page>.

functions.name: GetDrawColumn
functions.description:
Returns whether the <page>DMenu</page> should draw the icon column with a different color or not.

See <page>DMenu:SetDrawColumn</page>

returnValues.description: Whether to draw the column or not

functions.name: GetMaxHeight
functions.description: Returns the maximum height of the <page>DMenu</page>.

returnValues.description: The maximum height in pixels

functions.name: GetMinimumWidth
functions.description: Returns the minimum width of the <page>DMenu</page> in pixels

returnValues.description: the minimum width of the <page>DMenu</page>

functions.name: GetOpenSubMenu
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Returns the currently opened submenu.

Used internally to store the open submenu by <page>DMenu:Hide</page>, <page>DMenu:OpenSubMenu</page>.

returnValues.description: The currently opened submenu, if any.

functions.name: Hide
functions.description: Used to safely hide (not remove) the menu. This will also hide any opened submenues recursively.

functions.name: HighlightItem
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Highlights selected item in the <page>DMenu</page> by setting the item's key "Highlight" to true.

Doesn't appear to be working or used.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: The item to highlight.

functions.name: Open
functions.description: Opens the DMenu at the current mouse position

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: Position (X coordinate) to open the menu at.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Position (Y coordinate) to open the menu at.

arguments.name: skipanimation
arguments.description: This argument does nothing.

arguments.name: ownerpanel
arguments.description: If `x` and `y` are not set manually, setting this argument will offset the `y` position of the opened menu by the height of given panel.

functions.name: OpenSubMenu
functions.description: Closes any active sub menus, and opens a new one.

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: The <page>DMenuOption</page> to open the submenu at

arguments.name: menu
arguments.description: The submenu to open. If set to nil, the function just closes existing submenus.

functions.name: OptionSelected
functions.description: Called when a option has been selected

arguments.name: option
arguments.description: The <page>DMenuOption</page> that was selected

arguments.name: optionText
arguments.description: The options text

functions.name: OptionSelectedInternal
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called by <page>DMenuOption</page>. Calls <page>DMenu:OptionSelected</page>.

arguments.name: option
arguments.description: The <page>DMenuOption</page> that called this function

functions.name: SetDeleteSelf
functions.description:
Set to true by default. IF set to true, the menu will be deleted when it is closed, not simply hidden.

This is used by <page>DMenuBar</page>

arguments.name: newState
arguments.description: true to delete menu on close, false to simply hide.

functions.name: SetDrawBorder
functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

Does nothing.

functions.name: SetDrawColumn
functions.description: Sets whether the <page>DMenu</page> should draw the icon column with a different color.

arguments.name: draw
arguments.description: Whether to draw the column or not

functions.name: SetMaxHeight
functions.description: Sets the maximum height the <page>DMenu</page> can have. If the height of all menu items exceed this value, a scroll bar will be automatically added.

arguments.name: maxHeight
arguments.description: The maximum height of the <page>DMenu</page> to set, in pixels

functions.name: SetMinimumWidth
functions.description: Sets the minimum width of the <page>DMenu</page>. The menu will be stretched to match the given value.

arguments.name: minWidth
arguments.description: The minimum width of the <page>DMenu</page> in pixels

functions.name: SetOpenSubMenu
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally to store the open submenu by <page>DMenu:Hide</page>, <page>DMenu:OpenSubMenu</page>, <page>DMenu:CloseSubMenu</page>

arguments.name: item
arguments.description: The menu to store

name: DMenuBar
description: A simple menu bar.

functions.name: AddMenu
functions.description:
Creates a new <page>DMenu</page> object tied to a <page>DButton</page> with the given label on the menu bar.

This will create a new menu regardless of whether or not one with the same label exists. To add **or** get a menu, use <page>DMenuBar:AddOrGetMenu</page>.

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: The name (label) of the derma menu to create.

returnValues.description: The new <page>DMenu</page> which will be opened when the button is clicked.

functions.name: AddOrGetMenu
functions.description:
Retrieves a <page>DMenu</page> object from the menu bar. If one with the given label doesn't exist, a new one is created.

To add a DMenu without checking, use <page>DMenuBar:AddMenu</page>.

arguments.name: label
arguments.description: The name (label) of the derma menu to get or create.

returnValues.description: The <page>DMenu</page> with the given label.

functions.name: GetDrawBackground
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>DMenuBar:GetPaintBackground</page> instead.</deprecated>

Returns whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as <page>DMenuBar:GetPaintBackground</page>

returnValues.description: Should the background be painted

functions.name: GetIsMenu
functions.description: Returns whether or not the panel is a menu. Used for closing menus when another panel is selected.

returnValues.description: Is a menu

functions.name: GetOpenMenu
functions.description: If a menu is visible/opened, then the menu is returned.

returnValues.description: Returns the visible/open menu or nil.

functions.name: GetPaintBackground
functions.description: Returns whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as <page>DMenuBar:GetDrawBackground</page>

returnValues.description: Should the background be painted

functions.name: SetDrawBackground
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>DMenuBar:SetPaintBackground</page></deprecated>

Sets whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as <page>DMenuBar:SetPaintBackground</page>

arguments.name: shouldPaint
arguments.description: Should the background be painted

functions.name: SetIsMenu
functions.description:
Sets whether or not the panel is part of a DMenu.

If this is set to `true`, <page>Global.CloseDermaMenus</page> will not be called when the panel is clicked, and thus any open menus will remain open.

arguments.name: isMenu
arguments.description: Is this a menu

functions.name: SetPaintBackground
functions.description: Sets whether or not the background should be painted. Is the same as <page>DMenuBar:SetDrawBackground</page>

arguments.name: shouldPaint
arguments.description: Should the background be painted

name: DMenuOption
description:
<internal></internal>

Internal subpanel that represents an option used by <page>DMenu</page>.

functions.name: AddSubMenu
functions.description: Creates a sub <page>DMenu</page> and returns it. Has no duplicate call protection.

returnValues.description: The created <page>DMenu</page> to add options to.

functions.name: GetChecked
functions.description: Returns the checked state of <page>DMenuOption</page>.

returnValues.description: Are we checked or not

functions.name: GetIsCheckable
functions.description: Returns whether the <page>DMenuOption</page> is a checkbox option or a normal button option.

functions.name: GetMenu
functions.description: Returns which <page>DMenu</page> this option belongs.

returnValues.description: A <page>DMenu</page> to which this panel belongs.

functions.name: GetRadio
functions.description: Returns whether this <page>DMenuOption</page> should act like a radio button, set by <page>DMenuOption:SetRadio</page>.

returnValues.name: checked
returnValues.description: `true` to set as a radio button.

functions.name: OnChecked
functions.description: Called whenever the <page>DMenuOption</page>'s checked state changes.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: The new checked state

functions.name: SetChecked
functions.description:
Sets the checked state of the <page>DMenuOption</page>.

Invokes <page>DMenuOption:OnChecked</page>.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: `true` to set as checked.

functions.name: SetIsCheckable
functions.description:
Sets whether the <page>DMenuOption</page> is a checkbox option or a normal button option.

Enables automatic <page>DMenuOption:GetChecked</page> toggling with left/right clicks.

arguments.name: checkable
arguments.description: Whether the menu option should allow the player to toggle itself.

functions.name: SetMenu
functions.description: <internal></internal>Used to set the <page>DMenu</page> for this option.

arguments.name: pnl
arguments.description: The <page>DMenu</page> for this option.

functions.name: SetRadio
functions.description:
Sets whether this <page>DMenuOption</page> should act like a radio button.

Checking a radio button automatically unchecks all adjacent radio buttons.

arguments.name: checked
arguments.description: `true` to set as a radio button.

functions.name: SetSubMenu
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Used internally by <page>DMenuOption:AddSubMenu</page> to create the submenu arrow and assign the created submenu to be opened when this option is hovered.

arguments.name: menu
arguments.description: The sub <page>DMenu</page> this option belongs to.

functions.name: ToggleCheck
functions.description: Toggles the checked state of <page>DMenuOption</page>. Does not respect <page>DMenuOption:GetIsCheckable</page>.

name: DMenuOptionCVar
description:
<internal></internal>

An internal panel used by <page>DMenu</page>.
It acts as a menu option that can be checked.
It automatically sets and reads the given console variable.

It can be right clicked to toggle without closing the <page>DMenu</page>.

Use <page>DMenu:AddCVar</page> instead.

functions.name: GetConVar
functions.description: Returns the <page text="console variable">ConVars</page> used by the <page>DMenuOptionCVar</page>.

returnValues.description: The <page text="console variable">ConVars</page> used

functions.name: GetValueOff
functions.description: Returns the value of the <page text="console variable">ConVars</page> when the <page>DMenuOptionCVar</page> is not checked.

name: DModelPanel
description: DModelPanel is a VGUI element that projects a 3D model onto a 2D plane. See also <page>DAdjustableModelPanel</page>

functions.description: Returns the ambient lighting used on the rendered entity.

functions.description: Returns whether or not the panel entity should be animated when the default <page>DModelPanel:LayoutEntity</page> function is called.

returnValues.description: True if the panel entity can be animated with <page>Entity:SetSequence</page> directly, false otherwise.

functions.description: Returns the animation speed of the panel entity, see <page>DModelPanel:SetAnimSpeed</page>.

returnValues.description: The animation speed.

functions.description: Returns the color of the rendered entity.

returnValues.description: The color of the entity, see <page>Color</page>.

returnValues.description: The rendered entity (client-side)

functions.description: Returns the position the viewing camera is pointing toward.

returnValues.description: The position the camera is pointing toward.

functions.name: GetModel
functions.description: Gets the model of the rendered entity.

returnValues.description: The model of the rendered entity.

functions.name: LayoutEntity
functions.description:
By default, this function slowly rotates and animates the entity being rendered.

If you want to change this behavior, you should override it.

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: The entity that is being rendered.

functions.name: PostDrawModel
functions.description:
Called when the entity of the <page>DModelPanel</page> was drawn.

This is a rendering hook with 3d drawing context.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The clientside entity of the <page>DModelPanel</page> that has been drawn.

functions.name: PreDrawModel
functions.description: Called **before** the entity of the <page>DModelPanel</page> is drawn.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The clientside entity of the <page>DModelPanel</page> that has been drawn.

returnValues.description: Return false to stop the entity from being drawn. This will also cause <page>DModelPanel:PostDrawModel</page> to stop being called.

functions.name: RunAnimation
functions.description: This function is used in <page>DModelPanel:LayoutEntity</page>. It will progress the animation, set using <page>Entity:SetSequence</page>. By default, it is the walking animation.

functions.name: SetAmbientLight
functions.description: Sets the ambient lighting used on the rendered entity.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the ambient lighting.

functions.description: Sets whether or not to animate the entity when the default <page>DModelPanel:LayoutEntity</page> is called.

arguments.name: animated
arguments.description: True to animate, false otherwise.

functions.name: SetAnimSpeed
functions.description:
Sets the speed used by <page>DModelPanel:RunAnimation</page> to advance frame on an entity sequence.

<note><page>Entity:FrameAdvance</page> doesn't seem to have any functioning arguments and therefore changing this will not have any affect on the panel entity's sequence speed without reimplementation. It only affects the value returned by <page>DModelPanel:GetAnimSpeed</page></note>

arguments.name: animSpeed
arguments.description: The animation speed.

functions.name: SetCamPos
functions.description: Sets the position of the camera.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to set the camera at.

functions.name: SetColor
functions.description:
Sets the color of the rendered entity.

<note>This does not work on Garry's Mod player models since they use a different color system. To modify a player model color, see Example 2 on the <page>DModelPanel</page> page</note>

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The render color of the entity.

functions.name: SetDirectionalLight

arguments.name: direction
arguments.description: The light direction, see <page>Enums/BOX</page>.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the directional lighting.

functions.name: SetEntity
functions.description:
Sets the entity to be rendered by the model panel.

<note>If you set `ent` to a shared entity you must set `ent` to nil before removing this panel or else a "Trying to remove server entity on client!" error is thrown</note>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The new panel entity.

functions.name: SetFOV
functions.description: Sets the panel camera's FOV (field of view).

arguments.name: fov
arguments.description: The field of view value.

functions.name: SetLookAng
functions.description: Sets the angles of the camera.

arguments.name: ang
arguments.description: The angles to set the camera to.

functions.name: SetLookAt
functions.description: Makes the panel's camera face the given position. Basically sets the camera's angles (<page>DModelPanel:SetLookAng</page>) after doing some math.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The position to orient the camera toward.

functions.name: SetModel
functions.description:
Sets the model of the rendered entity.

<note>This function may give a different model than expected. This is not a bug, however this problem may appear with some player models which are renamed several times in a wrong way. To solve that, you can use <page>Entity:SetModel</page> and <page>Entity:SetModelName</page> on the internal panel entity. More information : https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod-issues/issues/4534.</note>

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The model to apply to the entity.

functions.description: Runs a <page>Global.ClientsideScene</page> on the panel's entity.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The path to the scene file. (.vcd)

name: DNumberScratch

Zoom in by moving your mouse forward and moving back does the opposite. Looks like a blue circle until you click and hold on it

name: DScrollPanel
description:
DScrollPanel is a VGUI Element similar to DPanel however it has a vertical scrollbar docked to the right which can be used to put more content in a smaller area. DScrollPanels are essentially <page>DPanel</page>s with the Scroll Bar.

This can be used to replace the <page>DPanelList</page> with <page>DPanelList:EnableVerticalScrollbar</page> and get similar functionality as well as using a non-deprecated element.

If you would like to paint or edit the elements of the scrollbar use <page>DScrollPanel:GetVBar</page>. If you want to see if the scrollbar is visible then use the VBar.Enabled variable on the scrollbar's VBar.

<note><page>Panel:DockPadding</page> will not have an effect on children of this panel. Use the function on <page>DScrollPanel:GetCanvas</page> instead.</note>

name: DTextEntry
description:
A form which may be used to display text the player is meant to select and copy or alternately allow them to enter some text of their own.

<note>At least one of your `DTextEntry`'s parents must either be an <page>EditablePanel</page> or derived from it (like a <page>DFrame</page>, for example), else it won't be able to focus and thus be unselectable.

You must also call <page>Panel:MakePopup</page> on said panel or the `DTextEntry` will not work.</note>

functions.name: AddHistory
functions.description:
Adds an entry to <page>DTextEntry</page>'s history.

See <page>DTextEntry:SetHistoryEnabled</page>.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Text to add to the text entry's history.

functions.name: AllowInput
functions.description:
Called whenever the value of the panel has been updated (whether by user input or otherwise).

It allows you to determine whether a user can modify the <page>TextEntry</page>'s text.

By default, this only checks whether the panel disallows numeric characters, preventing it from being edited if the value contains any.

This is actually an engine hook that only works on <page>TextEntry</page> derived elements.

If you are looking for a way to modify character limits, see <page>Panel:SetMaximumCharCount</page>

arguments.name: char
arguments.description: The last character entered into the panel.

returnValues.description: Return `true` to prevent the value from changing, `false` to allow it.

functions.name: CheckNumeric
functions.description:
Returns whether a string is numeric or not.
Always returns false if the <page>DTextEntry:SetNumeric</page> is set to false.

arguments.name: strValue
arguments.description: The string to check.

returnValues.description: Whether the string is numeric or not.

functions.name: GetAutoComplete
functions.description: Called by the DTextEntry when a list of autocompletion options is requested. Meant to be overridden.

arguments.name: inputText
arguments.description: Player's current input.

returnValues.description: If a table is returned, the values of the table will show up as autocomplete suggestions for the user.

functions.description: Returns the cursor color of a DTextEntry.

returnValues.description: The color of the cursor as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.description:
Called by <page>DTextEntry:OnTextChanged</page> when the user modifies the text in the <page>DTextEntry</page>.

You should override this function to define custom behavior when the <page>DTextEntry</page> text changes.

functions.description:
<internal></internal>
Called internally when the text inside the <page>DTextEntry</page> changes. This is an implementation of <page>TextEntry:OnTextChanged</page>

You should not override this function. Use <page>DTextEntry:OnValueChange</page> instead.

arguments.name: noMenuRemoval

functions.name: OnValueChange
functions.description:
Called when the text changes of the <page>DTextEntry</page> are applied. (And set to the attached console variable, if one is given)

See also <page>DTextEntry:OnChange</page> for a function that is called on every text change, even if the console variable is not updated.

You should override this function to define custom behavior when the text changes.

This method is called:
* When Enter is pressed after typing
* When <page>DTextEntry:SetValue</page> is used
* For every key typed - only if <page>DTextEntry:SetUpdateOnType</page> was set to true (default is false)

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The DTextEntry text.

name: DTileLayout
description:
Similarly to <page>DIconLayout</page>, this lays out panels in two dimensions as tiles.

The difference between this and <page>DIconLayout</page> is that <page>DIconLayout</page> items all have the same height while
<page>DTileLayout</page> items do not have this enforcement.
<page>DTileLayout</page> will find the best way to "pack" its children.
For example, in a two column layout, a item of height 2 units will be placed in one column while
two items of height 1 unit will be placed in the other column.

It is worth noting however that because this panel iterates through its children in an undefined order and lays out while
it is iterating, there is no guarantee that this packing will lead to the lowest possible height.

This is used by the spawnmenu to arrange spawnicons.

The base size defines the smallest a tile can be, and it will resize vertically to accommodate all child panels.
The number of elements in each row is determined by the base size and width.

It also optionally permits the rearrangement of these tiles.
To enable this functionality, call <page>DDragBase:MakeDroppable</page> on the DTileLayout with a unique identifier.
All panels added following this will be moveable.

functions.description: <internal></internal> Clears the panel's tile table. Used by <page>DTileLayout:LayoutTiles</page>.

functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to designate a range of tiles as occupied by a panel.

arguments.description: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the panel.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the panel.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The panel's width.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: The panel's height.

The y coordinate of the found available space.

functions.name: Layout
functions.description: Resets the last width/height info, and invalidates the panel's layout, causing it to recalculate all child positions. It is called whenever a child is added or removed, and can be called to refresh the panel.

functions.name: LayoutTiles
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called by <page>PANEL:PerformLayout</page> to arrange and lay out the child panels, if it has changed in size.

functions.description: Called when anything is dropped on or rearranged within the DTileLayout.

functions.name: SetBaseSize
functions.description:
Sets the size of a single tile. If a child panel is larger than this size, it will occupy several tiles.

If you are setting the size of the children properly then you probably don't need to change this.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The size of each tile. It is recommended you use `2` (`16, 32, 64...`) numbers, and those above `4`, as numbers lower than this will result in many tiles being processed and therefore slow operation.

functions.description: Sets the spacing between the border/edge of the <page>DTileLayout</page> and all the elements inside.

functions.name: SetMinHeight
functions.description: Determines the minimum height the DTileLayout will resize to. This is useful if child panels will be added/removed often.

arguments.name: minH
arguments.description: The minimum height the panel can shrink to.

functions.name: SetSpaceX

arguments.name: spacingX

functions.name: SetSpaceY
functions.description: Sets the spacing between 2 elements in the <page>DTileLayout</page> on the Y axis.

arguments.name: spaceY
arguments.description: New Y axis spacing.

functions.name: SetTile
functions.description: <internal></internal> Called to set the occupied state of a tile.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the tile.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the tile.

arguments.name: state
arguments.description: The new state of the tile, normally `1` or `nil`.

name: DTree
description:
A tree view element for Derma.

See also <page>DTree_Node</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the option.

arguments.name: icon

functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Calls directly to <page>Panel:InvalidateLayout</page>.
Called by <page>DTree_Node</page>s when a sub element has been expanded or collapsed.

Used as a placeholder function alongside <page>DTree:ExpandTo</page>, <page>DTree:SetExpanded</page> and <page>DTree:MoveChildTo</page>.

The <page>DTree</page> acts a root node and methods with the same name in <page>DTree_Node</page> call to the parent.

<internal></internal>

Does nothing. Used as a placeholder empty function alongside <page>DTree:MoveChildTo</page>, <page>DTree:SetExpanded</page> and <page>DTree:ChildExpanded</page>.

The <page>DTree</page> acts a root node and methods with the same name in <page>DTree_Node</page> call to the parent.

functions.description:
<deprecated></deprecated>

The <page>DTree</page> acts a root node and methods with the same name in <page>DTree_Node</page> call to the parent.

Enables the "click when drag-hovering" functionality.

If enabled, when hovering over any <page>DTree_Node</page> of this <page>DTree</page> while dragging a panel, the node will be automatically clicked on (and subsequently <page>DTree:OnNodeSelected</page> will be called) to open any attached panels, such as spawnlists in spawnmenu.

See also: <page>PANEL:DragHoverClick</page>.

name: DTree_Node
description:
<internal></internal>

This panel is created whenever you add a node to a <page>DTree</page>.
The root node of a <page>DTree</page> is also a <page>DTree_Node</page> and controls much of its action. it can be accessed with <page>DTree:Root</page>.
